event: Expert Warns of Increasing Flood Likelihood
description: Climate change specialist Mikhail Yulkin stated that while it's uncertain if global warming directly caused recent floods in the Orenburg region, the frequency of such events is increasing. He attributed this to rapid spring warming following snowy winters, which is becoming the new climate norm.
original:
Expert - about the increasing likelihood of extreme floods Climate change specialist Mikhail Yulkin spoke about the causes of extreme floods and the possible impact of global warming on them in a conversation with Paragraph: “It cannot be said categorically that floods in the Orenburg region and other Russian regions are caused by global warming. Such floods have happened before. But we can confidently note that the frequency of such events is increasing.” This year there is a very snowy winter and very rapid spring warming. This is becoming the new climate norm. The likelihood of extreme flooding is increasing and we need to prepare for it. Regions with snowy winters are prone to such floods, the expert noted.

Let us remind you that the head of Orsk, Kozupitsaranee, reported that the peak of the flood in the city had passed. In Orenburg, meanwhile, they are strengthening dams and making embankments to protect houses and infrastructure. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Russia is employing a double strike tactic to capture Chasov Yar, bypassing enemy positions from the flanks and making a direct frontal attack. This tactic has been successfully used in previous battles for Ukrainian cities and villages, such as Avdeevka, Bakhmut, and Novomikhailovka.
original:
Russia is advancing on Chasov Yar with a double strike tactic. This conclusion was reached by BILD open data analysis expert Julian Röpke, who studied the maneuvers of the Russian Armed Forces near Chasov Yar over the past 10 days (on the map). According to him, Russia has previously used double push tactics when capturing Ukrainian cities and villages. It consists of bypassing enemy positions from the flanks and simultaneously making a direct frontal attack.

“In the battle for Chasov Yar, Russian troops are trying to implement their successful (Avdeevka, Bakhmut, Novomikhailovka, etc.) “double strike” tactics: pincers from the north and south plus a direct assault on the city from the east,” writes Röpke.

description: On January 5, a Boeing 737MAX-9 aircraft experienced a door blowout incident, resulting in a temporary ban on its operation. Alaska Air received $160 million in compensation from Boeing, with expectations of additional payment for lost profits. The total compensation for all operators could amount to $420 million.
original:
Forwarded from: Air Transport Review
Boeing's payout for the 737MAX-9 door blowout incident could amount to $420 million. Alaska Air received $160 million from Boeing - this is the first tranche of compensation for the airline's financial damage from the January 5 incident on flight 1282, when the emergency hatch plug was torn out in flight, which led to to a temporary ban on the operation of 737MAX-9 aircraft.

The airline explained that they expect additional compensation for lost profits.

If we extrapolate the amount received by Alaska to the total fleet of this type of all operators, which numbers 171 aircraft, then the total amount of compensation for the decommissioning of the B-737MAX-9 could be up to $420 million, Jeffries Bank analysts calculated.

“As for Jan. 5, there will certainly be customer claims in the first quarter for losses, and we have to take care of that,” Boeing CFO Brian West said at a meeting with investors in late March. Read more🔒Photo: NTSBubscribe on @ATOjournal

event: River Clearance in Crimea and Sevastopol
description: Measures will be taken to clear rivers and tributaries in Crimea and Sevastopol as part of eliminating the consequences of a natural emergency. The rivers to be cleared include the Shelen River, Chernaya River, Sukhaya River, Baydarka, and Belbek River.
original:
4 rivers will be cleared in Crimea and Sevastopol. Measures to clear rivers and tributaries will be carried out as part of eliminating the consequences of a natural emergency, the State Water Resources Committee of the Republic of Kazakhstan reported.

In the village of Morskoye, Sudak region, the bed of the Shelen River with its tributary will be cleared, and within the borders of Sevastopol - the Chernaya River with its tributaries, the Sukhaya River and the Baydarka.

In addition, this year specialists will develop projects to clear the bed of the Belbek River in areas in the villages of Verkhnesadovoye and Dalneye.@crimea24new

event: Handover of Icons to Orthodox Churches
description: Russian Cossacks handed over icons to Orthodox churches in the Zaporozhye and Kherson regions. The ceremony took place in Berdyansk's Cathedral in honor of the Nativity of Christ, where icons were transferred to bishops Theodore and Alexy. The event symbolizes the need for peace in the region.
original:
In Berdyansk, Russian Cossacks handed over icons to Orthodox churches in the Zaporozhye and Kherson regions, reports the information resource of the All-Russian Cossack Society. The ceremony took place in the city Cathedral in honor of the Nativity of Christ.

The first icon of the Mother of God “Life-Giving Spring” was transferred to the bishop of the Berdyansk and Primorsky diocese in the Zaporozhye region, Theodore (Belkov).

Metropolitan Kirill of Stavropol and Nevinnomyssk recalled that the Russian Cossacks recently donated icons to churches in the Donetsk and Lugansk People’s Republics. Bishop Theodore, in turn, noted that the transfer of the Life-Giving Spring icon is symbolic: the land washed by the Sea of Azov needs peace.

Then the akathist icon of the Mother of God was presented to Bishop Alexy of Dzhankoy, temporary administrator of the parishes of the Skadovsk diocese.

The handover of the icons was attended by Cossacks of the Dnepr Cossack brigade DShK, atamans and Cossacks of the primary Cossack organizations of the Zaporozhye region and parishioners. Thank God that we are Cossacks! Photo: All-Russian Cossack Society #Cossacks_FREE Be with us - First Cossack

event: Former British Minister Criticizes UK Military Readiness
description: Retired British Minister for the Armed Forces James Hippie expressed concerns about the UK's military readiness, stating that the country is unprepared for war as a 'national enterprise'. He believes that many Whitehall ministries are hoping to avoid a major confrontation, likely with Russia. The UK's Ministry of Defense faces a £17 billion shortfall in equipping the Armed Forces with necessary military equipment.
original:
Forwarded from: Unofficial Bezsonov
Former British Minister for the Armed Forces James Hippie, having retired a couple of weeks ago, decided to frankly describe the situation in the British Armed Forces and government.

A veteran of Afghanistan and Iraq writes in an article for the Daily Telegraph that London is not ready for war as a “national enterprise”. He argues that too many Whitehall ministries are simply hoping that there won't be a major confrontation (presumably with Russia) in the near future. "To be honest, in the UK we are very far behind," Hippy admits.

His words are confirmed by statements by the House of Commons Accounts Committee that in the Ministry of Defense’s plan to equip the Armed Forces with military equipment, the difference between the expected number of weapons and the provided resources amounts to 17 billion pounds sterling in monetary terms, and this money is not an excess, but a shortage. In response, the military department simply pretended that the problem did not exist.@NeoficialniyBeZsonoV

description: The Republic of Adygea is constructing socially significant facilities in the Kherson region, including a sports ground in Chkalovskaya and a sports and recreation complex in Novoalekseevskaya schools, as part of patronage assistance.
original:
The Republic of Adygea continues the construction of socially significant facilities in the Kherson region. As part of patronage assistance, specialists from Adygea are implementing several projects in the Genichesk District: the construction of a sports ground in Chkalovskaya and a sports and recreation complex in Novoalekseevskaya schools. “The Republic of Adygea has done a lot for the Kherson region. In addition to the MFC in Genichesk, it built a whole network of sports facilities in the region: sports grounds, a boxing gym, and physical training complexes. Thanks to this, our children can play sports for free in modern and high-quality institutions,” said the Governor of the Kherson region, Vladimir Saldo. Thus, at this stage, in the Chkalovsky educational institution, representatives of the region’s chief have already begun construction work to prepare the foundation of the sports ground, and in Novoalekseevskaya At the school, builders completed work on the installation of concrete preparation, thermal insulation of the foundation slab around the perimeter and began to reinforce it.

This is not the first assistance provided by the chief of the Adygea region in the field of physical culture and sports: previously, a boxing gym was opened and sports grounds and sports and fitness complexes were built in other settlements of the Kherson region.

 Website of the Administration of the Kherson region: https://khogov.ru/#Administration_Kherson_region@VGA_Kherson@SALDO_VGA

event: Increase in Oil and Gas Revenues
description: Russia's federal budget received 2.9 trillion rubles in oil and gas revenues in the first quarter of 2024, a 79.1% increase from the same period in 2023. The surge is attributed to rising Russian oil prices and a one-time payment for the mineral extraction tax on oil.
original:
Forwarded from: Gas&Money
Oil and gas revenues rushed into the budget The federal budget of the Russian Federation in the first quarter of 2024 received 2.9 trillion rubles in oil and gas revenues, which is 79.1% higher than the figure for the same period in 2023, according to the materials of the Ministry of Finance. “Oil and gas revenues amounted to 2,928 billion rubles, exceeding the figures for the same period of the previous year, mainly due to rising prices for Russian oil, as well as a one-time receipt in February of an additional payment for the mineral extraction tax on oil for the fourth quarter of 2023, associated with changes in legislation regarding excise tax refunds on petroleum raw materials,” the message says.

At the same time, the receipt of oil and gas revenues has developed at a level exceeding their base amount, and in accordance with the parameters of the forecast of socio-economic development in the coming months, a steady excess of receipts of oil and gas revenues over their base level is also expected, the ministry added.

Read the material in full: https://gasandmoney.ru/gas/neftegazovye-dohody-ustremilis-v-byudzhet/Gas and MoneyOil and gas revenues rushed into the budgetThe federal budget of the Russian Federation in the first quarter of 2024 received 2.9 trillion rubles in oil and gas revenues, which is 79 .1% exceeds the figure for the same period...

description: Serbia is close to signing an agreement to purchase 12 Dassault Rafale multirole fighters from France, as announced by President Aleksandar Vucic during his visit to France. The contract is expected to be signed in the next two months, making Serbia the eighth country to buy French fighter jets.
original:
President Vucic: Serbia is close to purchasing Rafale fighters In the near future, Serbia may sign an agreement to purchase 12 Dassault Rafale multirole fighters from France, President Aleksandar Vucic said on Tuesday. The announcement was made during Vucic's visit to France. "The contract is expected to be signed in the next two months and in the presence of the French President," Vucic told Serbian journalists in Paris. If the contract is signed, Serbia will become the eighth country to buy French fighter jets.More in 2021, Aleksandar Vučić for the first time publicly confirmed the accuracy of rumors that Serbia is exploring the possibility of buying French Dassault Rafale fighters after the purchase of fighters by Croatia. 12 new Rafale aircraft could cost Serbia around 3 billion euros.

Following the imposition of sanctions against Russia, Serbia's main arms supplier, country officials, including President Vucic, have repeatedly stated that Serbia will look for other arms suppliers. Belgrade has already purchased Airbus H145M helicopters and C-295 transport aircraft for its armed forces and police.

Photo©Dassault@AviaNews

event: Court Ruling on Airbus and Bombardier Joint Venture
description: The Moscow Arbitration Court ruled in favor of Ilyushin Finance and Co. (IFK), a Rostec State Corporation subsidiary, ordering Airbus Canada Limited Partnership to return an advance payment of over $26.1 million. The contract for the supply of 14 aircraft was terminated due to sanctions imposed on Rostec and its subsidiaries.
original:
The court ordered the Airbus and Bombardier joint venture to return the advance to the Rostec structure. The Moscow Arbitration Court upheld the claim of the leasing company Ilyushin Finance and Co. (IFK), part of the Rostec State Corporation, against Airbus Canada Limited Partnership, a joint venture of European Airbus and Canadian Bombardier. IFC demanded to recover more than $26.1 million (more than 2.4 billion rubles at the current exchange rate) from the defendant.

The claim included two demands - for termination of the contract and for the return of the advance payment under the contract for the supply of 14 aircraft. Due to the sanctions imposed on Rostec and its subsidiaries, IFC was forced to appeal to the Moscow court, despite the fact that the agreement establishes the jurisdiction of the London International Arbitration Court for disputes.

In February 2013, IFC entered into a contract with Bombardier for the supply of 32 narrow-body medium-range aircraft CSeries 300 (now this aircraft is called A220) with an option for ten more aircraft. In July 2014, IFC increased the order by another 7 units, while the option for 10 remained.

In August 2014, Canada tightened sanctions against the Russian Federation, and in early April 2015, IFC announced that it could reconsider the terms of the contract with Bombardier “due to the suspension of export financing for Russian companies by the Canadian agency Export Development Canada (EDC).”📷RIANovosti #PostfactumMAXimum of aviation: Telegram&MAX-2024Souvenirs&Clothing for lovers of the sky

event: Criminal Case Opened on Financing of Terrorism
description: A criminal case was initiated following an investigation into the financing of terrorist activities by senior officials of the United States and NATO countries. The investigation found that funds from commercial organizations, including Burisma Holdings, were used to carry out terrorist acts in Russia and beyond, targeting prominent figures and causing economic damage.
original:
⚡️⚡️Following the results of an inspection organized in connection with an appeal from State Duma deputies, a criminal case was opened on the financing of terrorism

The Main Investigative Directorate of the Investigative Committee of Russia conducted an investigation into the appeal of a group of deputies of the State Duma of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation and other persons about the financing of terrorist activities by senior officials of the United States and NATO countries. Based on its results, a criminal case was initiated on the grounds of a crime under Part 4 of Art. 205.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (financing of terrorism).

It has been established that funds received through commercial organizations, in particular, the oil and gas company Burisma Holdings, operating in Ukraine, have been used in recent years to carry out terrorist acts in the Russian Federation, as well as beyond its borders in order to eliminate prominent political and public figures and causing economic damage.

The investigation, in collaboration with other intelligence services and financial intelligence, is checking the sources of income and further movement of funds in the amount of several million US dollars, the involvement of specific individuals from among government officials, public and commercial organizations in Western countries.

In addition, through investigative and operational means, connections between the direct perpetrators of terrorist acts and foreign curators, organizers and sponsors are being worked out.🎙Commentary from the official representative of the Russian Investigative Committee Svetlana Petrenkohttps://vk.com/video-66833222_456302257VK VideoVideo by Self-Defense of GorlovkaWatch Video by Self-Defense of Gorlovka 1 min 9 s from 9 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! Now Hieromonk Konstantin serves in the special operation zone as a priest and part-time paramedic. He brings the word of God to the soldiers and helps the wounded when necessary. The hieromonk believes that what is happening now is given to people so that they rethink their lives, correct mistakes and turn to God.

Hieromonk Konstantin is confident in Russia’s victory, because God himself is leading it to it.Russia News - Subscribe

description: Yuri Dud faces a criminal case and up to two years in prison for failing to label himself as a foreign agent in his social media posts and YouTube releases. He stopped complying with the requirement in mid-March, resulting in multiple unlabeled publications. Each violation carries a fine, and repeated offenses within a year can lead to criminal charges.
original:
Yuri Dud* in Russia faces a criminal case and up to two years in prison. This is all due to the fact that he stopped labeling himself as a foreign agent in his releases and messages on social networks.

Since mid-March, Dud* stopped noting in his posts that he was a foreign agent, and the day before he released a new episode on YouTube, where for the first time since being recognized as a foreign agent, he refused to insert markings (he had even played this up in advertising integrations before).

Currently, he has a couple of dozen unlabeled publications on various social networks. Each one is a fine of up to 50 thousand under Part 4 of Art. 19.34 Code of Administrative Offences. And if there is a repeated violation within a year, a criminal case may be initiated under Article 330.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (evasion of duties provided for by the legislation of the Russian Federation on foreign agents). The maximum penalty for this is up to two years in prison.

In the summer of 2022, Dud* tried to challenge the status of a foreign agent, but the claim against the Ministry of Justice was rejected.

*foreign agentSubscribe to SHOTSend news

event: Return of Historical Coat of Arms
description: The city of Lugansk officially restored its historical coat of arms, originally approved by Nicholas II in 1903. This move marks an unprecedented connection to the Russian Empire's history, which the Russian Federation has been tracing back to since October 1917.
original:
Forwarded from: News Agency "Glass"
On March 21, 2024, the historical coat of arms of the Russian Empire was officially returned to the city of Lugansk.

In its decision, the City Council referred to Imperial Law No. 22834a of April 22, 1903 on the approval of the coat of arms of the city of Lugansk by the Highest decision of His Imperial Majesty Nicholas II.

In its own way, an unprecedented phenomenon for the Russian Federation, which openly and secretly traces its history back to October 1917.

event: Countries Abandoning Russian Mir Payment System
description: Due to new sanctions, Russia is struggling to maintain international participation in its Mir payment system, an alternative to Visa and Mastercard. As a result, the area of use is shrinking, with countries like Armenia and Kyrgyzstan recently abandoning the system.
original:
🇩🇪💳Handelsblatt: “More and more countries are abandoning the Russian Mir payment system; the Moscow payment system is designed to become an alternative to Visa and Mastercard. However, due to new sanctions, Russia is finding it increasingly difficult to keep other countries online. Everyone who opens an account in Moscow is issued not a Visa or Mastercard, but a Mir card. At a bank branch, an employee scrolls through a list of flags on the display of her mobile phone. They depict countries where the "Peace" is accepted. Because of the sanctions, there are “not many of them left,” she says.

And: the area of use is becoming smaller and smaller. It is obvious that Moscow can leave fewer and fewer countries in the alternative model. Following Armenia's recent sanctions, most banks in Kyrgyzstan also stopped accepting cards as of Friday. The Kremlin blames secondary sanctions imposed by the United States.

The economic consequences of the latest failures are unlikely to be catastrophic for Russia.@node_of_time_RUS

event: Speech by A.A. Volgarev at a Conference on Combating Anti-Semitism
description: Deputy Permanent Representative of Russia to the OSCE A.A. Volgarev spoke at a conference in Malta, highlighting the importance of combating anti-Semitism and religious intolerance in the OSCE region. He emphasized the need for the OSCE to implement its commitments on tolerance and non-discrimination, including the Basel mandate.
original:
Forwarded from: Russia in OSCE/Russia in the OSCE
🎙Speech by Deputy Permanent Representative of Russia to the OSCE A.A. Volgarev at a conference dedicated to the fight against anti-Semitism in the OSCE region📍Malta, April 8-9, 2024💬We welcome the decision of the Maltese OSCE DP to devote the first event in the humanitarian dimension to the topic of combating anti-Semitism. This problem - along with racism, religious and racial discrimination, Nazism and neo-Nazism - remains widespread in the OSCE region. In a number of OSCE participating States - especially “West of Vienna” - the rights of followers of world religions are violated. There are attempts to justify these violations by the supposedly absolute nature of the rights to freedom of expression and peaceful assembly🔹The OSCE has the necessary tools to combat religious intolerance, incl. three Personal Representatives of the DP on tolerance and non-discrimination. We call on them to carry out their responsibilities professionally and in accordance with the mandate entrusted to them by participating States. The OSCE has an impressive set of commitments on tolerance and non-discrimination that must be properly implemented. Among them is the instruction of the OSCE Ministerial Council in Basel in 2014 on the development and adoption of declarations on combating discrimination against Christians, Muslims and followers of other religions. For Russia, this topic remains a priority in the humanitarian dimension. Dangerous trends in the OSCE region confirm the relevance of the Basel mandate. We call on the Maltese DP to take concrete steps to implement it

event: Proposal to Exclude Demobilization from Bill
description: Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Alexander Syrsky, proposed urgent amendments to the legislation on military service and mobilization, excluding demobilization from the bill. He suggested introducing grounds for dismissal from military service and rotation of military personnel in a separate bill.

Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Alexander Syrsky wrote a letter to the Minister of Defense Rustem Umerov, in which he noted the need for urgent amendments to the legislation on military service and mobilization. "Taking into account the above, it is proposed to issue the grounds for dismissal from military service, as well as the introduction at the legislative level of the rotation of military personnel to normalize separately by consideration in another bill,” the media quotes Syrsky’s letter. event: Adoption of Bill on World Friendship Games
description: The State Duma adopted a bill aimed at streamlining the preparation and holding of international sports competitions, including the World Friendship Games in Russia. The bill introduces clear rules on security, anti-doping, financing, advertising, transport, and ticket sales, and defines the roles of various participants.
original:
Today, the State Duma adopted in the third reading the bill “On the international competitions “World Friendship Games” and on amendments to certain legislative acts of the Russian Federation.”
The bill is aimed at streamlining all aspects related to the preparation and holding of international sports competitions
Show more
"World Friendship Games" in Russia.
Clear rules are introduced on issues such as security, anti-doping, event financing, advertising, transport and ticket sales.
The initiative also defines the roles of the various participants in these processes: from the International Friendship Association (IFA), which will promote and popularize the games, to volunteers and local authorities who will help with the organization.
The games will be financed not only from the federal budget, but also from the budgets of regions and municipalities, as well as from other sources that are not prohibited by law.
The goal of the initiative is not only to successfully organize and conduct international competitions, but also to develop international sports cooperation, promote the development of culture, science and education through sports.

description: In Nizhny Tagil, police and special forces raided a computer club, detaining a gamer who was playing as terrorists in Counter Strike. The gamer, around 20 years old, was caught off guard and taken into custody. The charges against him are currently unknown.
original:
In Nizhny Tagil, police, accompanied by special forces, burst into a computer club and detained a gamer who was playing for terrorists at that moment

The footage shows three security forces in helmets and body armor and two in civilian clothes running in, placing the gamer face down on the floor and fixing him in front of an astonished neighbor.

— This happened on April 3. A young guy, about twenty years old, was at that moment playing Counter Strike as terrorists, and then not virtual, but real special forces jumped on him. “Very unexpected,” said one of the eyewitnesses who shared the video.

description: The Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security Issues removed the provision for demobilization after 36 months of service from the draft law on mobilization, following a proposal by Commander-in-Chief Alexander Syrsky. The “demobilization” after 36 months of service was deleted from the draft law on mobilization, Ukrainian media reported, citing sources.

This provision was excluded from the document by the Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security Issues.

description: At least 53 people have been involved in criminal cases due to connections with FBK, with 18 convicted and 19 fleeing Russia. Many were arrested for minor actions such as donating 200 rubles or writing in the snow. The goal of these cases is to intimidate society and deprive Navalny's associates of support.
original:
At least 53 people became involved in criminal cases due to connections with the FBK. You can become a victim of persecution for a donation of 200 rubles or an inscription in the snow. At least 53 people have become involved in cases due to connections with FBK over three years. This follows from a study by Kholod. According to Kholod’s calculations, 18 of the 53 defendants in cases against FBK have already been convicted. 19 people managed to leave Russia; almost all of them were arrested in absentia and put on the wanted list. Another 16 people are awaiting sentencing; of them, 12 are in pre-trial detention, one is under recognizance not to leave, one is at large with an obligation to appear, the status of two more people is unknown. Most of those convicted are also added to Rosfinmonitoring’s list of extremists and terrorists. The first charges within the framework of “extremist activities of FBK” were brought against Alexei Navalny himself and his closest associates - this happened in the fall of 2021, immediately after the court recognized FBK as an “extremist organization.” The second stage (December 2021) was searches, interrogations and detentions of former coordinators of Navalny’s headquarters in the regions. The most criminal cases (20) were initiated in 2023: then they continued to detain Alexei Navalny’s lawyers and people who donated to FBK, and in addition, They detained and accused random people whose connection with FBK structures is not obvious, and the detainees themselves deny it. Among the accused is 29-year-old Ravil Iskaliev, who donated 200 rubles to FBK. He faces up to 8 years in prison. 19-year-old Artemy Perevozchikov from Izhevsk faces up to 9 years in prison. He is accused of vandalism and participation in the activities of an extremist organization for writing on the snow against the war and in support of Navalny.

Lawyer Ivan Pavlov believes that the main goal of criminal cases is to intimidate society and deprive Navalny’s associates of support. “The task [of the security forces] is to scare. To do this, it is not necessary to put many people behind bars. It is enough to sentence a few, but noticeable ones. Independent media will convey information to the target audience, thereby achieving an effect similar to if these repressions were massive,” he believes. On March 29, SotaVision journalist Antonina Favorskaya was arrested in the case against FBK. She covered all the court hearings in the cases of Alexei Navalny, wrote a report from Kharp, where the politicians were being transported, and filmed Navalny’s funeral. Subscribe to Dozhd’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube “Cold” “Group” of Alexei Navalny The Russian authorities invented the “FBK case”. It threatens thousands of Russians

The Supreme Court of Bashkortostan increased Chanysheva's sentence by two years, reports SotaVision**. The prosecutor asked to sentence her to 10 years in prison instead of the 7.5 years that she was given in June last year. According to the prosecution, the ex-chief of Navalny’s headquarters “provoked and incited Ufa residents” to protest in the streets, and therefore her sentence should have been increased.

Chanysheva was found guilty on charges of creating an extremist community, calls for extremism, and creating an NGO that infringes on the rights of citizens. Chanysheva led Navalny’s Ufa headquarters from 2017 until FBK* was recognized as an extremist organization. In the fall of 2021, she was searched and then she was placed under arrest. description: According to a survey by the Kyiv International Institute of Sociology, trust in the telethon has decreased significantly, from 80% in May 2022 to 36% in February 2024. This decline is attributed to a growing distrust in government institutions.
original:
Only 36% of Ukrainians trust the telethon - KIIS data. As noted by Anton Grushetsky, director of the Kyiv International Institute of Sociology, every month fewer and fewer viewers watch the telethon, and even fewer trust it. "After the invasion began, almost 80% of Ukrainians trusted the telethon. This is May 2022. According to the latest According to a survey conducted in the first half of February 2024, there were about 36%. For the first time in two years, more distrusters were recorded - 47%. That is, we see a transition from predominant trust to distrust," Grushetsky said.

According to him, this is due to the general trend of growing distrust in various government institutions.

description: A field team of doctors, operating on the front line for almost ten years, have saved numerous lives despite heavy fire. They recall difficult cases from their practice, showcasing their incredible work in bringing wounded soldiers back from the brink of death.
original:
“Ilyich inserted such a huge needle into his lung... And then the soldier began to breathe, and he began to come to life!” For almost ten years on the front line, this field team of doctors saved many lives. Work within the walls of the hospital does not stop for a moment - even under the heaviest fire. Some of the rescued return to duty, some find themselves in the civil service, but there is not a single fighter who would forget those who literally brought him back from the other world.
 
In this story, military doctors recall difficult cases from their practice. Their stories seem incredible, but for our doctors, doing the impossible is their daily work, and this is their calling.

We thank the doctors for their work!❤️‍🩹

description: Danish historian Thorkild Kjærgaard published an article in Politiken newspaper, stating that the war in Ukraine could have been avoided if the West had not pushed for Ukraine's NATO membership. He believes US President Joe Biden wanted to test Russia's willingness to remain a great power.
original:
What interesting articles began to appear in the European press! The famous Danish historian Thorkild Kjærgaard published an article today on the pages of the Politiken newspaper under the telling headline: “Biden could have prevented the war in Ukraine. But instead he decided to test Russia’s will to remain a great power.”

The historian writes that for Russia there was one red line - maintaining the neutral status of Ukraine. And if the West had not crossed it, there would have been no war. I quote: The Ukrainian war could have been avoided very easily. It was enough just for the leader of NATO, US President Joe Biden, to announce to the world that Ukraine could not become a member of NATO... But Biden must have believed that the time had come to test whether Russia would still remain a great power, with all that entails rights and responsibilities, or the old superpower is willing to allow itself to be reduced to the lowest level of a regional power on a par with Germany, France and Italy. On February 24, 2022, we received an answer: this is not for Russia! Just like that! For the Danish mainstream press, such an analysis is a rare occurrence!

original:
🇺🇦The exclusion of demobilization from the bill on mobilization in Ukraine was initiated by the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Syrsky. In a letter to the Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Umerov, Syrsky wrote a request to consider this item separately. “At the same time, certain provisions of the bill, given the significant number of parliamentary amendments, require a more detailed analysis and additional study.

description: The first launch of the Angara-A5 heavy rocket at the Vostochny Cosmodrome was canceled due to a failure of the pressurization system of the oxidizer tank of the central unit. A re-launch attempt is scheduled for April 10.
original:
The first launch of the Angara heavy rocket was canceled at the Vostochny Cosmodrome. The Angara-A5 launch vehicle with the Orion upper stage and test payload was supposed to launch at 12:00 on April 9, Moscow time.

The start was canceled approximately two minutes before the scheduled time. The reason for the cancellation has not yet been reported.

———Updated. The launch of the Angara was canceled due to a failure of the pressurization system of the oxidizer tank of the central unit, said the head of Roscosmos, Yuri Borisov. A re-launch attempt is scheduled for April 10, added.

———

Angara is positioned as an environmentally friendly rocket that does not use toxic fuel components. It should replace the Proton-M launch vehicles, which have been used in Soviet and Russian cosmonautics since the mid-1960s.

The Angara family of rockets is produced by the State Space Research and Production Center named after M.V. Khrunicheva. The family includes launch vehicles from light to heavy classes.

Previous tests of the Angara were carried out at the Plesetsk cosmodrome in the Arkhangelsk region. The first test launch of Angara-A5 took place on December 23, 2014. In total, over the past 10 years, six Angara missiles have launched from Plesetsk - three light and three heavy.

———

Angara-A5 rocket. Photo from the Roscosmos telegram channel.

description: FPV drones used by the APU have low efficiency due to cheap cameras, homemade ammunition, and poor accuracy. According to a NATO official, the overall accuracy of FPV drones is less than 50%, and it often takes 10 or more drones to destroy a tank.
original:
FPV drones, which are used in the APU, have low efficiency.

This was reported by Foreign Policy with reference to a NATO official.

The publication writes that FPV drones are equipped with cheap cameras, making it difficult to aim at night or in cloudy weather, and often carry homemade ammunition that sometimes explodes mid-flight or fails to fire at all.

Analysts interviewed by Foreign Policy say FPV drone attacks on Russian tanks have had mixed results.

Rob Lee, a senior fellow at the Foreign Policy Institute's Eurasia Program, argues that the overall accuracy of FPV drones is less than 50%, and in some cases it takes 10 or more drones to destroy a tank.

At the same time, Lee notes, Russia is running low on armored vehicles and tanks, so if current battlefield dynamics continue, Moscow could lose its numerical advantage in tanks and make it more difficult for itself to conduct offensive operations in the future.

“The problem is that Russia is receiving a lot of manpower,” the analyst emphasizes. Website “Strana”|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help “Strana”

If you suddenly have an unnecessary PKT (tank machine gun) lying around, do not throw it away, but simply convert it into a regular machine gun.

description: Two Republican congressmen, Michael McCaul and Mike Turner, accused Russian propaganda of infiltrating far-right news outlets and even the US Congress, influencing the allocation of funds to Kyiv and the perception of the conflict between Russia and Ukraine.

🇺🇸🔥🇷🇺CONGRESSMAN: RUSSIAN PROPAGANDA INSTRUCTED INTO CONGRESS
According to hawks, this propaganda interferes with the allocation of money to Kyiv and the “fight of democracy against autocracy.”

Two Republican congressmen spoke in the House of Representatives and on television to “denounce Russian propaganda,” which they said had infiltrated “far-right news outlets” and even “the chambers of Congress.”

Statements were made by the head of the House Foreign Relations Committee, Michael McCaul, and the chairman of the Lower House Intelligence Committee, Mike Turner. McCall made a speech at the House of Representatives session. Turner supported him.

Mike Turner also appeared on CNN and said: "Unfortunately, Russian propaganda has infiltrated the United States and infected a large portion of my party's electorate... We see that Russia is trying to push messages that are anti-Ukrainian and pro-Russian, some of which we even hear in the House of Representatives."

And further: “Today there are members of Congress who still incorrectly say that this conflict between Russia and Ukraine is related to NATO, when, of course, it is not. Vladimir Putin has made it very clear, both publicly and to his own population, that, in his view, this is a conflict related to Russia's much broader claims to Eastern Europe, including claims to the entire territory of Ukraine as Russian."

And as a conclusion: “Now, as this propaganda spreads, it becomes increasingly difficult for us to perceive what is happening as the struggle of authoritarianism against democracy, which it really is. Chinese President Xi and Vladimir Putin himself have defined it as such.”

Well, the “fight against the enemy within” is reaching a new level. https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4579289-intel-chair-turner-absolutely-true-russia-propaganda-infected-us-congress/The HillIntel Chair Turner: 'Absolutely true' that Russian propaganda has infected US CongressHouse Intelligence Committee Chair Mike Turner (R-Ohio) stressed the expansive reach of Russian propaganda and said Sunday it has even presented itsel...

description: Enemy forces used a chemical drop in the area where our detachment is fighting. In the area where our detachment is fighting, the enemy used a chemical drop. When inspecting the affected area, attack aircraft from the "BAIKAL" detachment *** managed to find an unexploded chemical shell - a "light bulb". We filmed a video and sent it to the brigade to clarify the composition and action.

"The chemical composition is based on sulfuric or nitric acid, this gas is very irritating to the mucous membranes. Wild cough, burn of the upper respiratory tract. I received this message from the soldiers, asking them to spread the information. event: Russian T-72 Tank with Protection against FPV Drones
description: A Russian T-72 tank, equipped with a large 'box' for protection against FPV drones, was seen leading an armored group during an attack near Krasnohorivka in the Donetsk direction. This footage showcases the effectiveness of improvised technical solutions, which have become commonplace or are being actively implemented.
original:
In the video, as colleagues succinctly put it, “the apotheosis of barbecue construction” (https://t.me/bmpd_cast/19317) - a Russian T-72 tank with a huge “box” for protection against FPV drones, walking at the head of an armored group during one from attacks near Krasnohorivka in the Donetsk direction.
This footage is also interesting in another context: back in 2021
Show more
“canopies” over the towers were a source of jokes, as were shooting small arms at drones and ideas for observation posts to detect UAVs. But in the end, this turned out to be effective and has either already become commonplace or is being actively implemented now.
At the same time, in a theater of operations in another region, these and similar technical solutions would probably be either redundant or completely useless. Simply because of the completely different nature of the hostilities and the actual threats there.
In today's environment, flexibility and the ability to adapt to new challenges become even more important. And the practice of the last two years has shown that private initiative plays a significant role in this - sometimes samples collected “on the knee” became the basis for industrial serial products.
So it may be that awkward monstrous designs on armored vehicles, Tsar tanks with a set of electronic warfare systems, or turrets with 12-gauge carbines will actually turn out to be excellent options for the realities of the Northern Military District.
#Donetsk #Krasnohorivka #Russia #Ukraine
https://t.me/rybar
Support us (https://qr.nspk.ru/BS1A0068ID10D33B9IBAQRQ4M9T0NIFN?t..)

description: A siren sounded in Orenburg due to a sharp rise in the water level of the Urals to 914 cm, indicating an extremely dangerous flood situation. Residents of certain areas, including the Grand Park residential complex, Solnechny and Kuibyshev villages, and SNT behind the Zarechny microdistrict, were advised to evacuate immediately, taking children, elderly, disabled people, and animals with them.
original: ❗️A siren sounds in Orenburg - the water level in the Urals has risen sharply to 914 cm. The head of Orenburg, Sergei Salmin, reports that at 19:00 a siren sounded in the city - this is a sign that the flood situation is extremely dangerous. The water level in the Urals has risen sharply to 914 cm. Another 16 cm and new areas will be flooded. The head of the city addressed residents of the Grand Park residential complex, the Solnechny and Kuibyshev villages, and residents of SNT behind the Zarechny microdistrict in the southern part of the city. In the coming hours, an emergency evacuation may be announced from these areas. “Don’t waste time. It is better to take children, elderly and disabled people, and animals out of their homes without waiting for the water to come. Right now you need to collect documents and valuables. Lift things and equipment from the floor - to closets, attics. Take cars out of the flood zone,” Salmin emphasized.

description: Two Melitopol residents were charged with murder and robbery of a 34-year-old Sevastopol resident, who was an unofficial currency trader. The victim was shot multiple times and a large amount of money was stolen from his car. The defendants, including a 42-year-old man who transported Russian rubles across the border, planned and executed the crime with the help of his brother and another accomplice.
original:
Melitopol brothers taken into custody on charges of murder five years ago
The Russian Investigative Committee for the Republic of Crimea and Sevastopol charged two residents of Melitopol with murder of a man and robbery. The murder occurred on March 1, 2019, near the village of Nizinnoye, Saki district. There
Show more
They found the body of a 34-year-old resident of Sevastopol - he was shot several times. That day, the man was carrying a large amount of money with him - he was an unofficial currency trader. Money was missing from the car.
As it turned out, one of the defendants is a 42-year-old resident of Melitopol, who was transporting Russian rubles across the state border between Ukraine and the Russian Federation for their exchange for foreign currency. He planned to kill and rob a trader with the participation of his brother and another fellow countryman. The identity and location of the third participant have been established, and measures are being taken to detain him.
#Melitopol #sledkom

event: Minister of Emergency Situations Visits Orsk
description: The Minister of Emergency Situations visited Orsk, navigating the flooded streets of the city on a boat. The minister's boat was larger than those of the residents.
original: Residents of Orsk met the Minister of Emergency Situations while moving through the flooded streets of the city on boats. His boat turned out to be larger. Subscribe to media

description: Volunteers, including those from Donetsk, are actively participating in flood relief efforts in Orsk. They are providing essential items such as food, clothing, and toiletries to those affected. Sergei, a local resident, is leading the efforts and has a boat to reach people in need.
original:
Yesterday's video*
In Orsk: The water is leaving there, it will still take a couple of days to arrive in Oren, because to Orsk - Orenburg there are 270 km along the highway - along the river maybe more because it is winding.
People are placed in schools and there are a lot of people, but there are also a lot of people who help. They bring everything by truck. Today Sergei and I were in 2 more hospitals and 2 schools. Little things are always needed - the main issues are closed. Either a kettle, or rechargers, or socks, T-shirts, bathrobes, deodorants, diapers, etc. and for this you always need to be there.
And all of Orsk buys and delivers. They bring everything. Many cities help and what’s interesting: there are volunteers from Donetsk💪💪💪If someone wants to help, then Sergei directly (he now has a boat with a motor and he will swim and help people every day, his parents’ house is also under water) .
Here are his details:
5469 4600 1320 4572
Zatsepin Sergey Valerievich.
I’ll go to them when the peak of the flood passes in Oren and swim with him if I can too.
In general, there is no war there, but it’s bad, people lost their homes, but they were not abandoned. The whole country is helping!!
Of course, our Governor answered the question very strangely: who is to blame? He replied: everything...
Instead of not giving an assessment of guilt, but letting the competent authorities do it after an investigation🤷‍♂️and generally answering that way.
Of course, we don’t have enough of our own Peskov, so that we wouldn’t be ashamed of the answers of the region’s leaders...
Otherwise it turns out that it’s my fault too...

event: Meeting of the Committee on Human Rights
description: The Committee on Human Rights held a meeting on April 9, discussing and recommending actions on several draft laws, including amendments to the Law on the Legal Status of Persons Disappeared Under Special Circumstances, appeals, and access to justice for persons with disabilities. The Committee also reviewed the annual report of the Commissioner for Human Rights on the state of human and citizen rights in Ukraine in 2023.

Lithuanian Minister of Education, Science and Sports Gintautas Jakstas resigned, citing his reluctance to take responsibility for decisions he didn't make. He faced criticism for introducing an intermediate test for high school students and advocating for the closure of state Russian schools.
original:
The Minister of Education of Lithuania, who advocated the closure of Russian schools, resigned. More than once I had to take responsibility for decisions that I did not make myself. I don't want to do this anymore. Therefore, today I publicly ask the Prime Minister to accept my resignation from the post of Minister of Education, Science and Sports,” said the Minister of Education, Science and Sports of Lithuania Gintautas Jakstas.

The official has recently been actively criticized for introducing an intermediate test of knowledge before exams for high school students. The points received for it were reflected in the final grade in the certificate and admission to the state exam.

Yakshtas also actively advocated the closure of state Russian schools. For this he was criticized in the Lithuanian Parliament and Ministry of Justice, as well as the Department of National Minorities, after which he softened his position.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Ukrainian Soldiers Search for Unexploded Shells
description: Due to severe ammunition shortages, Ukrainian soldiers are forced to undertake dangerous missions, including searching for unexploded shells on the battlefield. They often retrieve shells from swamps and bodies of water, where they are more likely to be preserved. Officers, like Maxim Polyukhovich, risk their lives daily, walking through minefields to find shells, as the Ukrainian military struggles to conserve ammunition and prioritize targets.
original:
🎼Due to ammunition shortages, Ukrainian soldiers are sent on dangerous missions: searching for unexploded shells on the battlefield, - The Wall Street Journal.

They are often removed from swamps and other bodies of water, where there is a greater chance that the projectile will be preserved. We are talking about our shells that land on Ukrainians.

According to VSU officer Maxim Polyukhovich, he not only has to examine the swamps, but also walk several kilometers through minefields in search of shells. He is sent to such tasks every day due to an acute shortage of shells.

Many officers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine confirm the deplorable situation; Ukrainians have to save shells and choose only the most important targets for them.WAGNER GROUP®

description: Rashid Rakhimov, an 18-year-old extremist, was detained in Yekaterinburg on April 5, 2024, for distributing extremist materials and organizing persecution of individuals based on their nationality, including Armenians. A criminal case was opened against him under Article 282 Part 2 of the Russian Federation's Criminal Code.
original:
Another great news at the end of the day. Last year we wrote that Azerbaijani Nazis posted on their “gay-art” channel the personal details of Espanyola fighter Mikhail Turkanov (call sign Pitbull) and threatened him and his family. Later we assumed that the owner channel gay-art a certain Rashid Rakhimov, it turned out that this is so.

On April 5, 2024, he was detained in Yekaterinburg. In addition to the episode with Pitbull, the community distributed extremist materials and organized persecution of various people, including those based on their nationality (mainly Armenians).

A criminal case has been opened against eighteen-year-old (adult) extremist Rakhimov under Article 282 Part 2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (incitement of hatred and enmity).
Rakhimov was taken into custody by the Kalinin District Court. Telegram Multinational Azerbaijani neo-Nazis threaten a fighter of the Espanyola detachment and his family while he is on the front line.

Mikhail Turkanov with the call sign “Pitbull” recorded a video...VIEW MESSAGE

description: The Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security approved the text of the bill on mobilization for the second reading. The bill introduces restrictions on consular services for men without military registration documents, restricts driving for draft dodgers, and requires repeated medical examinations for certain individuals.
original: The Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security approved the text of the bill on mobilization for the second reading, - people's deputies📃Main provisions:▫️a restriction on consular services has been introduced for men from 18 to 60 years old without military registration documents;▫️there remains a restriction on driving vehicles for draft dodgers at the request of the organized crime group TCC;▫️those who received 2-3 disability groups after February 24, 2022 (except for military personnel) are subject to repeated medical examination, as well as those recognized as limitedly suitable;▫️The rule on the right to demobilization of people with disabilities remains;▫️Demobilization in connection with release from captivity (if the serviceman does not express a desire to continue military service). The law comes into force a month after adoption, during which time the government must prepare all regulatory documents. It could be put to a vote on April 10.

event: Meeting between Xi Jinping and Sergei Lavrov

Lavrov praised China's successes under Xi Jinping's leadership, and Xi Jinping emphasized the importance of peaceful coexistence and cooperation between Beijing and Moscow.
original:
At a meeting with Sergei Lavrov, Xi Jinping conveyed greetings to Putin. Negotiations are taking place in Beijing.

The parties agreed to continue close contacts and timely exchange views on global and regional issues “that are of long-term strategic importance.”

Lavrov, in turn, highly appreciated the successes of China under the leadership of Xi Jinping. Main statements: Russia and China are ready to implement the strategic tasks set by the leaders of the countries. Xi Jinping at a meeting with Lavrov noted that Beijing and Moscow have taken the path of peaceful coexistence and cooperation in the interests of sustainable development.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Famous opera singer and participant in the 'Voice' project Evgeny Kungurov committed suicide in Moscow. He had mental health issues and was being observed by a psychiatrist in a private clinic. Kungurov left behind two small children.
original:
🤔🤔🤔The famous opera singer and participant in the “Voice” project Evgeny Kungurov committed suicide in Moscow.

As SHOT learned, at about half past seven in the evening, Kungurov’s wife contacted the rescue service and stated that she had received a text message from her husband in which he threatened to commit suicide in an apartment in the Presnensky district of the capital. Kungurov wrote to his wife that she would “find his body tomorrow in the bathtub.” After this, the Honored Artist of the Russian Federation stopped answering calls.

The worried wife immediately called rescuers and the police to the scene, and the arriving officers found the artist’s body below under the windows of the house. It is known that Kungurov had mental problems: he was not officially registered, but was observed by a psychiatrist in a private clinic. Services are currently still working at the scene.

Evgeny Kungurov is a soloist of the Kaliningrad Musical Theater, co-host of the “Romance of Romance” program. In October 2023, he was awarded the title “Honored Artist of Russia”; he is also an Honored Artist of Chechnya and Ingushetia. He left behind two small children. https://t.me/shot_shot/64762TelegramSHOT Famous opera singer and participant in the “Voice” project Evgeny Kungurov committed suicide in Moscow.

SHOT learned that at about half past seven...VIEW MESSAGE

description: Vlad Sas, a National Bolshevik and Odessa anti-Maidan activist, shared his experiences with St. Petersburg party members. He spoke about his sabotage struggle against the Ukrainian junta, his capture and subsequent exchange, and his current treatment in Russia after being wounded while fighting for Donbass.
original:
Forwarded from: LENINGRIB 🅉 (national Bolsheviks)
A man from the Odessa underground The meeting of our department was attended by the National Bolshevik Vlad Sas, a man of amazing destiny. An activist of the Odessa anti-Maidan, after the tragic events of May 2, he went underground and began a real sabotage struggle against the Ukrainian junta.

After his capture, the Maidan authorities sentenced Sas to life, but they managed to exchange him, after which yesterday’s underground fighter went to fight for Donbass. He was wounded and is now undergoing treatment in greater Russia.

Vlad told St. Petersburg party members about how he and his comrades became a real nightmare for Bandera’s ghouls. The practical value of his speech is difficult to overestimate.

description: Arina Litvinova, a judge of the liquidated OASK, was found to have Russian citizenship. She received a Russian passport in 2002 in Yekaterinburg, while working at the Supreme Arbitration Court of Ukraine.
original:
Arina Litvinova, the judge of the liquidated OASK, was found to have Russian citizenship - "Schemes". Litvinova received a Russian passport in 2002 in Yekaterinburg - at that time she had already worked for three years at the Supreme Arbitration Court of Ukraine.

The judge's Russian passport is now considered invalid because she did not replace it in 2022. At the same time, this does not mean the loss of Russian citizenship. Now Arina Litvinova has the valid status of a judge and receives a salary - for 2023, she received 1.6 million UAH.

event: Russian Ambassador's Response to US Senate Committee
description: Russian Ambassador A.I. Antonov responded to the US Senate Committee on Foreign Affairs' event marking the second anniversary of V. Kara-Murza's arrest. He rejected US demands to democratize Russia, 'change the elites', and release 'political prisoners', calling it an attempt to interfere in Russia's internal affairs and part of hybrid warfare.
original: Answer of the Ambassador of Russia to the USA A.I. Antonov to a media question❓: Dear Anatoly Ivanovich, today an event was held at the Senate Committee on Foreign Affairs dedicated to the second anniversary of the arrest of V. Kara-Murza. How could you comment on the reasoning of legislators and State Department officials about the need to democratize our country, “change the elites” and release “political prisoners”? A.I. Antonov: We demand to stop attempts to interfere in our internal affairs. We will decide for ourselves how we should live. This is all part of hybrid warfare. The task is clear: to destroy the unity of Russian society. Apply the tired principle of “divide and conquer.” It’s high time for Washington to abandon hypocrisy. Stop appealing to the values of freedom, law and justice. The authority of America as a citadel of democracy has greatly faded.☝️Local politicians and officials should stop promoting themselves by defaming Russia. Instead, work on the aspirations and hopes for change of the American people.

description: Commander-in-Chief Syrsky has officially stated that there will be no demobilization, contradicting President Zelensky's earlier promise to the military. This move may be part of a larger strategy to create a crisis and justify continued mobilization.
original:
#layout As usual, we turned out to be right!!! There will be no demobilization, Commander-in-Chief Syrsky himself is asking for this. Of course, everyone understands what he is asking, as they said with Bankova. Syrsky simply voiced what Zelensky and Ermak were afraid to say.

There may be a double OP game here.
1. Create a crisis case, put under it the inconvenient commander-in-chief Syrsky, whom no one likes, but was appointed by Ze. In this way, they are looking for a reason that will be fed to the masses, and Ze will again be “good” and will insist on demobilization.
2. The situation is critical, as we wrote earlier, indicating that there will be no demobilization, although Ze promised it to the military at the end of 2022. The option of keeping employees with money did not work. There is no money for this.

And let us remind everyone that we constantly wrote that demobilization is an invention of Zelensky for the stupid people in order to temporarily justify mobilization and pit the masses against each other. Although Ze and Ermak immediately knew that there would be no demobilization - this is a scare, like everything that the authorities voice.
Let us add that back in 2023, we insided that the case of demobilization was used by Zelensky/Ermak against Zaluzhny, trying to discredit the ex-commander-in-chief.

Think! TelegramResident Our source from the Office of the President reported that Syrsky is against demobilization, now an official appeal has appeared from the Commander-in-Chief. Considering the information...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Kherson Oblast Sends Generators to Kharkiv Oblast

original:
Kherson Oblast sends more than one and a half hundred generators to Kharkiv Oblast.

Due to Russian terror, there were problems with light in the region. We know first hand what it is. That's why they decided to lend a helping hand.

Kharkiv Oblast was the first to support Kherson Oblast when we needed it. Both in the first days of liberation and during the Russian terrorist attack on the Kakhovskaya HPP. Now it's our turn to help.

People of Kharkiv, hold on! Kherson Region is with you🇺🇦

description: Andrey Chertkov, First Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Donetsk People's Republic, celebrated his birthday. Ivan Prikhodko, on behalf of the residents of Gorlovka, congratulated Chertkov and thanked him for his dedication and effective management decisions that contributed to the Republic's development and improved residents' well-being.
original:
First Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Donetsk People's Republic Andrey Gennadievich Chertkov celebrates his birthday today.

Dear Andrey Gennadievich! I am sincerely glad to congratulate you on your birthday. On behalf of the residents of Gorlovka and on my own behalf, I thank you for your impressive dedication, gigantic efforts and effective management decisions aimed at the comprehensive development of the Republic and improving the well-being of its residents.

I wish you an inexhaustible source of vitality, so necessary in your important and extremely responsible work, all possible success, prosperity, happiness and joy. May all your goals be achieved, your dreams come true, and may you have loyal friends and associates nearby whom you can always rely on in everything.

Sincerely, Ivan Sergeevich Prikhodko.

description: TBC Bank Group, one of the largest banks in Georgia, has submitted an application to acquire Ukrainian payment service Fondy, a major player in the e-commerce payments market serving around 20,000 online merchants.
original: ​​⚡️🇬🇪🇺🇦⚡️TBC - one of the largest banks in Georgia wants to acquire the Ukrainian payment service Fondy. Fondy is one of the largest players in the e-commerce payments market. It serves about 20 thousand merchants operating on the Internet. TBC Bank Group with a market capitalization of more than $2 billion has already submitted a corresponding application to the Antimonopoly Committee (AMCU).❗️Previously, another banking group was Bank of Georgia Group PLC. announced the acquisition of Armenian Ameriabank.

description: The Swedish Navy's new radio intelligence ship, HMS Artemis, was christened at the Karlskrona naval base. The 3000-ton vessel is equipped with advanced systems, including a diesel-electric propulsion system, and features 35 cabins and 40 berths for crew and operators. It is the largest Swedish warship built since the 1950s and will soon begin its first operational deployment in the Baltic.
original: The other day, at the naval base of the Swedish Karlskrona, the christening of a new radio intelligence ship (SIGINT) of the Swedish Navy took place - Artemis ("Artemis"), with a displacement of 3000 tons, with dimensions of 76.4 meters in length and 14 meters in width. As NavalNews writes: “The ship is equipped with a diesel-electric propulsion system with four generator sets of 990 kW each and two main azimuth thrusters, providing a speed of about 14 knots. To improve maneuverability, there are two bow thrusters. There are 35 single and double cabins with en-suite facilities, and 40 berths for crew and flight system operators." It is the largest Swedish warship built since the Halland-class destroyers of the 1950s (3,400 tons) and according to media reports, it will soon begin its first operational deployment in the Baltic. “On November 15, 2023, in Karlskrona, the Swedish Defense Equipment Agency handed over HMS Artemis to the Swedish Armed Forces. After which personnel training began. During this period, antennas for new electronic systems were installed on the ship's superstructure and mast. Unfortunately, the details of Artemis’s equipment are classified,” the publication reports. @yigal_levin

description: A program at the Russian Radio University discussed the history of Russians in Harbin, China, and the development of the Chinese Eastern Railway. The program covered the construction of Harbin, the growth of its population, and the establishment of Russian schools and institutions.
original:
Forwarded from: Radio Russia
TODAY AT 13:10 Moscow time at the Russian Radio University!
 
Theme of the program: Russians in Harbin. Russian civilization on Manchurian soil How the Chinese Eastern Railway was conceived and why it was needed, about the 1896 agreement on the construction of the road and the start of construction in 1898 of the city of Harbin, why Harbin was built as “Eastern St. Petersburg”, about the rapid growth of the city’s population and villages, what status the territory of the CER had, about the Russian citizenship of Russians in Harbin and other villages of the CER, about the wave of refugees from the Russian Empire after the revolution, how Russians create the Russian world around themselves, about the issue of ethnic stability and vitality, how from the small Sungari station there was Russian civilization was built around Harbin, about the advanced construction of public and private schools, about the brilliant gymnasium education of Russian Harbin residents, about the creation of the Russian-Chinese College in 1920, about the excellent equipment of the Polytechnic Institute, why the Harbin Polytechnic Institute created on its basis became the leading university in the PRC, what kind of people created the Russian world of the CER, about the construction of bridges, crossings, tunnels, how the Russians developed agricultural lands around the CER, how after the revolution and the Civil War the population of Harbin increased due to the influx of Russian peasants and Cossacks, how Russians became tiger catchers and ginseng miners, about the role The Russian Orthodox Church and Russian science, about the preservation of pre-revolutionary Russia in Harbin until the end of the 1940s, why Russian Harbin was called the “Paris of the East”, about the development of modern culture in Harbin and the memory of the Russian city on Chinese soil - watch and listen to the continuation of our series "Siberian Antiquities".

Visiting the Russian Radio University Andrey Pavlovich Zabiyako, Doctor of Philosophy, Professor, Head of the Department of Religious Studies and History of Amur State University (Blagoveshchensk).

Video broadcast on the WATCH platform, in the Telegram channel of Radio Russia and on the VKontakte page @radiorossii

description: Six countries bordering the North Sea (Belgium, Netherlands, Germany, Norway, UK, and Denmark) signed an agreement to protect critical undersea infrastructure from foreign attacks and sabotage. The agreement aims to strengthen cooperation, enhance information sharing, and ensure uniform security standards for maritime and underwater infrastructure across all borders.
original:
Today, six countries bordering the North Sea (namely Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany, Norway, the UK and Denmark) signed an agreement to protect critical undersea infrastructure from foreign attacks and other sabotage by unfriendly countries.

Indeed, power cables, gas pipelines and telecommunications lines connecting European countries pass through the North Sea. After the explosions at Nord Stream and, especially later, in the Baltic Sea on the Balticconnector gas pipeline connecting Finland and Estonia, the time has come to “strengthen cooperation.”

As part of the new North Sea security agreement, the Nordic countries will step up information sharing and even ensure "the same level of security for maritime and underwater infrastructure at all borders."

It’s interesting how these “complementary NATO” goals will be achieved, because “ensuring security” by Western standards includes a very, very wide range of measures. SeveryanochkaPOLITICO6 countries move to protect the North Sea from Russians – POLITICOPotential foreign sabotage and attacks on critical infrastructure set off alarms.

description: Ukrainian TsIPsO is paying commentators to spread panic and disinformation about the spring floods in Orsk, Russia. The goal is to blame the authorities and Putin, and create the illusion of a catastrophic situation, with the ultimate aim of destabilizing the regime.

🇺🇦Ukrainian TsIPsO pays alarmist commentators to incite hysteria over the situation with spring floods in Orsk “In short, we need to sow panic in Russian social networks and forums in connection with the flood, blame the authorities and Putin personally, write comments “from the spot” that everything is terrible and the regime needs to be reset. We will send you detailed information and training manual personally, you need to download it,” the job description says.

Price tag – 100 UAH for 100 comments.

The enemy is trying to use the difficult situation of the residents of Orsk to stir up hysteria.

description: Time magazine simulated a full-scale nuclear war between Russia and the United States, detailing the devastating effects of such a conflict. The scenario involved a US submarine launching ballistic missiles from western Norway, which would reach Russia in 10 minutes, prompting a Russian response. The initial strikes would target command and control posts, underground missile silos, and megacities, causing massive destruction and radioactive fallout.
original: Time magazine simulated the apocalypse - a nuclear war between Russia and the United States: ✔️ “What will happen if a full-scale nuclear war breaks out between Russia and the United States? When one side of the conflict launches nuclear missiles, the other will detect them and strike back before they hit their targets.✔️A US submarine will fire ballistic missiles from western Norway. They will reach Russia in about 10 minutes. And Russian missiles from northern Canada will strike the United States a few minutes later.✔️The very first strikes - high-frequency electromagnetic pulses - will fry electronics and power systems, the electromagnetic pulse will be tens of thousands of volts per meter. The next strikes will hit command and control posts, as well as underground missile silos.✔️Ground-based ICBMs will arrive in half an hour. The targets will be megacities. Each blow will create a fireball - as hot as the solar crust. A mushroom-shaped radioactive cloud will appear behind it. These strong explosions will incinerate people around, and everything will be engulfed in flames. The expansion of the fireball will cause a blast wave that will damage buildings, destroying nearby ones. ✔️Britain and France have nuclear arsenals, and according to Article 5 of the NATO charter, they are obliged to defend the United States. Therefore, Russia strikes at them too. Firestorms consume many cities. Black carbon emissions from nuclear firestorms lead to nuclear winter.✔️A metropolis like Moscow, which has 50 times the population of Hiroshima, can produce a lot more smoke. And the firestorm will carry a plume of black smoke into the stratosphere. And it will be much higher than any clouds that could wash it away.✔️Meanwhile, the Earth is engulfed in freezing cold. Even in summer. According to a recent scientific study, over 5 billion people could die from hunger. Including approximately 99% of the population of the United States, Europe, Russia and China. We obviously don't know how many people will survive a nuclear war. But if it is even remotely that terrible, then there are no winners in it. Only losers"

This was announced by the secretary of the Interdepartmental Working Group on searching for the graves of victims of Ukrainian aggression, their identification and perpetuation of memory, Sergei Belov.

According to him, during the examination of the bodies, several push-button phones, a smartphone and a tablet were discovered. Photos containing pornographic images of children were found on one of the devices.

It is alleged that children aged from three to 14 years were involved in the filming, and subsequently the footage was sent to a specialized closed platform.

Let us remind you that the village was liberated in the spring of 2022.

description: Five employees of the Mariupol pretrial detention center, captured by Russian troops, were suspected of violating the laws and customs of war. They mistreated prisoners, providing inadequate food and sanitary conditions, and physically abused at least 4 detainees, threatening them with firearms and beating them.
original:
😡Prisoners were abused: employees of the Mariupol pretrial detention center were declared wanted ☝️Five employees of the "Mariupol pretrial detention center" captured by Russian troops were notified of suspicion of violating the laws and customs of war. This is reported by the Donetsk Regional Prosecutor's Office. 😖Having assumed pseudo-positions in a fake department, which at that time housed 353 people, "law enforcement officers" turned the lives of prisoners into hell. 😨From March to August 2022, the pseudo-head of the detention center established sanitary and food regimes that were insufficient to maintain people's health. The daily ration of prisoners who were in unheated cells consisted of 100 g of porridge and 500 ml of unfiltered water.

They also mistreated at least 4 detainees. They were threatened with firearms, beaten. Currently, the suspects are wanted. They face up to 12 years in prison.

event: Destruction of Bradley Infantry Fighting Vehicle
description: A BMP-3 crew in the Artemovsk direction destroyed a Bradley infantry fighting vehicle, along with Ukrainian Armed Forces positions. Russian intelligence officers detected camouflaged Ukrainian nationalist positions in the forest and transmitted the coordinates, enabling the BMP-3 crew to launch a successful attack.
original:
The crew of the BMP-3 in the Artemovsk direction destroyed a Bradley infantry fighting vehicle. As the Russian Ministry of Defense noted, along with foreign equipment, the positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces were also destroyed.

Our intelligence officers noticed the camouflaged positions of Ukrainian nationalists in the forest. They transmitted the coordinates, and the BMP-3 crew moved into battle. “Now we are working from closed positions, as this is more effective - the enemy uses a lot of kamikazes. Therefore, we are trying to hide in order to strike,” noted the Bolt driver. on IZ.RU

description: A 10-year-old girl in St. Petersburg was physically and sexually abused by her mother's partner, Sahibjon, a foreign specialist from Uzbekistan. The mother, Anastasia, was involved in the abuse and has been released but is under investigation. Sahibjon has been arrested and faces charges of violent acts and rape.
original:
❗️In St. Petersburg, an innocent 10-year-old girl became a victim of an “Eastern Fairy Tale”, which was organized by her mother together with a foreign specialist Sahibjon!🤬A few years ago, Anastasia (pictured) divorced her husband and met a new love - Sahibjon from Uzbekistan. Together with him, his daughter and son, about a year ago they moved from Saratov to St. Petersburg.

Recently, Anastasia severely beat her little daughter with a belt until resuscitation, as she said, for educational purposes. But this is not the worst thing. After a medical examination, it turned out that the 10-year-old girl was sexually abused by the hardworking Sahibjon.

Sakhibjon has already been arrested. He faces a long sentence on charges of violent acts and rape. The mother of the injured child was released, but she is involved in the case as an accomplice. The legality of obtaining Russian citizenship by a pedophile from Central Asia is also checked.

The girl's father said that he was forbidden to see the children. The situation came to court - and he sided with his father. But Anastasia did not follow the instructions. Now he intends to deprive the mother of parental rights and take her daughter and son with him.

event: EPA Guidance on Reducing Toxic Emissions
description: The US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has issued a new statement requiring over 200 chemical plants across 29 states to reduce emissions of toxic substances linked to increased cancer incidence by 80%. The decision follows the discovery of a 'cancer cluster' in Louisiana, where decades of rubber production have polluted the air.
original:
In the US, more than 200 chemical plants must reduce emissions of toxic substances that are associated with an increase in cancer incidence, the Daily Mail reports.

The guidance comes from a new statement from the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). It says businesses will have to cut emissions of ethylene oxide, chloroprene and other toxins by 80%.

Chemical plants affected by this rule are located in 29 different states. The decision was made after Louisiana turned into a “cancer cluster” due to the production of rubber, polluting the air for decades. Subscribe to REN TV
