event: Meeting between Sergei Lavrov and Chinese Foreign Minister
description: Sergei Lavrov met with the head of the Chinese Foreign Ministry to discuss regular consultations and intergovernmental cooperation in practical areas, including economics, trade, investment, and new technologies. The meeting aimed to promote a fair multipolar world order, free from dictatorship, hegemony, and neocolonial practices.
original:
Sergei Lavrov on the results of negotiations with the head of the Chinese Foreign Ministry.
“We talked about contacts through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, we just signed, in your presence, a plan for regular consultations, and briefly touched upon certain issues of intergovernmental cooperation in practical areas. This set of tasks will be discussed in more detail
Show more
be considered during the upcoming five intergovernmental commissions this year, headed by deputy prime ministers in preparation for the next regular meeting of heads of government. The issues that we are addressing in the field of economics, trade, investment, the introduction of new technologies, they directly relate to the struggle for the establishment of a fair multipolar world of order, where there is no place for dictatorship, where there is no place for hegemony, where there is no place for neocolonial and colonial practices, which are now in full swing. applied by the United States and the rest of the so-called collective West, which has submitted, unquestioningly, to the will of Washington."

event: Death of Junior Sergeant Yakov Sidletskyi
description: Junior Sergeant Yakov Sidletskyi, call sign 'Saint', died on February 23, 2024, in Minkivka, Donetsk region, while serving in the 30th separate mechanized brigade named after Prince Konstantin Ostrozky.
original:
🕯In memory of junior sergeant Yakov Sidletskyi (call sign "Saint") Yakov graduated from the Hrynivetsky educational complex in Zhytomyr region, after which he studied at the Zhytomyr Agricultural Technical College, majoring in "Agroengineering" and completed his military service. The man worked at an agricultural enterprise, where he dealt with machinery.

When a full-scale war broke out, Yakov took his family to the village to live with his parents. There he learned that a summons had been issued in his name. So on February 25, the day of his birth, the man went to the Military Commissariat and stood up for the defense of Ukraine. He served in the 30th separate mechanized brigade named after Prince Konstantin Ostrozky.

event: Criminal Case Opened on Financing of Terrorism
description: A criminal case was opened following an appeal from State Duma deputies regarding the financing of terrorist activities by senior US and NATO officials. The investigation found that funds from Burisma Holdings, a Ukrainian oil and gas company, were used to carry out terrorist acts in Russia and beyond, targeting prominent figures and causing economic damage.
original:
Forwarded from: Investigative Committee
Based on the results of an inspection organized in connection with an appeal from State Duma deputies, a criminal case was opened on the financing of terrorism. The Main Investigation Department of the Investigative Committee of Russia conducted an investigation following an appeal from a group of deputies of the State Duma of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation and other persons about the financing of terrorist activities by senior officials of the United States and NATO countries. Based on its results, a criminal case was initiated on the grounds of a crime under Part 4 of Art. 205.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (financing of terrorism).

It has been established that funds received through commercial organizations, in particular, the oil and gas company Burisma Holdings, operating in Ukraine, have been used in recent years to carry out terrorist acts in the Russian Federation, as well as beyond its borders in order to eliminate prominent political and public figures and causing economic damage.

The investigation, in cooperation with other intelligence services and financial intelligence, verifies the sources of income and further movement of funds in the amount of several million US dollars, the involvement of specific individuals from among government officials, public and commercial organizations of Western countries. In addition, the connections of direct perpetrators of terrorist acts with foreign curators, organizers and sponsors. Commentary from the official representative of the Russian Investigative Committee Svetlana PetrenkoSubscribe to Sledkom

description: An interview with a tank battalion commander, nicknamed 'Thor', revealed his unique personality and military background. He fought with the Wagner PMC and later joined the Nevsky volunteer brigade of the Ministry of Defense, which operates in the Northern Military District zone.
original:
TANK BATTALION COMMANDER: “I LOVE TANKS LIKE A BEAUTIFUL GIRL”

The SVO revealed one truth for us, the military: an officer or soldier should not always be recruited according to the formula “pre-conscription-recipient-conscript-recruit-soldier”. The military should be able to bring a person to headquarters and firmly say: “We desperately need this guy.” And don’t care about selection (except for the test of loyalty to the Motherland). This may not be a hero outwardly, but in the army we need what we need.

Battalion commander "Thor" is similar to Lenin, only with the figure of a bodybuilder. And the actor Malkovich. Wow, what an extraordinary person he is. I barely stopped the interview, and only because “Thor” had to go and lead a tank attack. He fought as part of the Wagner PMC, then transferred to the Nevsky volunteer brigade of the Ministry of Defense. The Volunteer Corps of the Russian Defense Ministry, which includes several such brigades, is fighting in the Northern Military District zone.

description: A brutal murder occurred in the basement of a furniture company on Taganskaya Square in Moscow. A 41-year-old handyman, Alexander Smirnov, killed a 30-year-old man, Nikita Ts., after a drunken quarrel. Smirnov poured foam into the victim's mouth and private parts, causing his death. Smirnov was detained and a criminal case has been initiated under the article 'Murder'.
original:
Brutal murder in Moscow: a handyman beat a man and filled his mouth and private parts with foam in the basement of a furniture company. The victim died.

According to SHOT, this morning two men, 30 years old and 41 years old, who had been drinking all night, quarreled in the basement of a furniture company on Taganskaya Square. From words they turned to a fight, and then the enraged 41-year-old man grabbed foam, poured it into his opponent’s mouth and something else. The victim died on the spot. The body with his trousers down was found and emergency services were called.

The suspect was detained. According to our information, this is Moscow resident Alexander Smirnov (pictured). The man has loan debts - at least 155 thousand rubles. He worked as a laborer and was not officially employed anywhere. He has a wife and three children. His wife told us that in recent months Alexander drank a lot and rarely raised his hand. The day before he called his wife and said that he would drink beer and come home, but he never returned. And today he called again - he said that he had killed a man and now “he will be leaving for a long time.” The woman is sure that he went crazy because of alcohol.

A criminal case has been initiated under the article "Murder". The deceased, 30-year-old Nikita Ts., also from Moscow. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

description: Seda Suleymanova, a native of Chechnya, was taken away by her relatives from St. Petersburg and stopped communicating. A friend of a native of Chechnya, Seda Suleymanova, rejected the version of her repeated escape. THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) WAS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY A FOREIGN AGENT, MEMO LLC, OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF A FOREIGN AGENT, MEMO LLC. 18+

The version of Seda Suleymanova’s relatives that the girl ran away again looks implausible, says her friend Lena Patyaeva. According to her, Seda said more than once that her relatives could kill her.

Let us recall that an investigator in Chechnya summoned Lena Patyaeva for an interview in the case of the murder of her friend Seda Suleymanova, who was taken away by relatives from St. Petersburg and stopped communicating. On April 3, it became known that the Investigative Committee, in responses to the authors of appeals demanding an investigation into the disappearance of Seda Suleymanova, notified that a criminal investigation had begun.

The version of Seda Suleymanova’s relatives that the girl left home again on February 5, 2024 does not stand up to criticism, Seda’s friend Lena Patyaeva told Sota. “To believe that they could admit that she ran away from them, to believe that she ran away without contacting anyone - neither human rights activists, nor me, nor Stas - well, it’s simply impossible. This is what , that the relatives claim that she ran away, “left” them on February 5, and at the same time on February 6, journalists called the relatives, and they were told that she was here, she was nearby,” Patyaeva emphasized in a video interview with Sota, which was published in the Telegram channel of the publication. description: A siren sounded in Orenburg due to a sharp rise in the water level of the Urals to 914 cm, indicating an extremely dangerous flood situation. original: ❗️A siren sounds in Orenburg - the water level in the Urals has risen sharply to 914 cm. The head of Orenburg, Sergei Salmin, reports that at 19:00 a siren sounded in the city - this is a sign that the flood situation is extremely dangerous. The water level in the Urals has risen sharply to 914 cm. Another 16 cm and new areas will be flooded. The head of the city addressed residents of the Grand Park residential complex, the Solnechny and Kuibyshev villages, and residents of SNT behind the Zarechny microdistrict in the southern part of the city. In the coming hours, an emergency evacuation may be announced from these areas. “Don’t waste time. It is better to take children, elderly and disabled people, and animals out of their homes without waiting for the water to come. Right now you need to collect documents and valuables. Lift things and equipment from the floor - to closets, attics. Take cars out of the flood zone,” Salmin emphasized.

description: Regional human rights ombudsman Mark Denisov highlighted issues with military registration and organization during partial mobilization in the Krasnoyarsk Territory. This led to the conscription of individuals with medical limitations, fathers of many children, and employees of military-industrial complex organizations.
original: The Ombudsman spoke about the problems of those mobilized from the Krasnoyarsk Territory. Mobilization revealed a number of problems associated with insufficient awareness and organization of military registration, says regional human rights ombudsman Mark Denisov. “As a result, during partial mobilization, there were numerous cases of conscription of fathers of many children, citizens with medical limitations, employees of organizations of the military-industrial complex, etc.,” writes Denisov. For example, a resident of the region did not have time to remove a metal structure from his leg due to mobilization. At the request of the Ombudsman, the man was examined by a doctor, prescribed treatment and a recommendation to remove it. However, he did not have any indications for a medical examination and was sent back to the unit. They should not have called up a forest firefighter yet, since his position is subject to reservation. It turned out that before the start of mobilization he was not registered with the military and the employer did not take measures to reserve him. A similar incident occurred in Achinsk. The mobilized man’s wife reported that her husband is an employee of an enterprise included in the register of defense industry enterprises. The lists of the enterprise were submitted to the military registration and enlistment office, but the man did not receive a deferment. The regional military registration and enlistment office responded that the employer did not provide all the necessary documents.@mobilizationnews

description: Foreign Policy criticized Ukrainian FPV drones, citing their low effectiveness, which depends on operator training, target type, and environmental conditions. The article revealed that drone attacks have had mixed results, with an overall effectiveness of less than 50%. FPV drones are considered improvised weapons for specific tasks and cannot compare to artillery ammunition in terms of maintaining a high rate and density of fire.
original:
The American publication Foreign Policy suddenly criticized Ukrainian FPV drones. And although the headline of the article contains the catchy phrase “Cheap Ukrainian drones are destroying Russian tanks,” there is another in small print: “They are not a long-term solution to the problem of the shortage of artillery shells.” The article says that the transition of Ukrainian troops to drones is due to the US refusal to supply artillery shells. It is noteworthy that the material reveals the main problem of FPV drones - the low level of effectiveness, which directly depends on the operator’s training, the type of target and the conditions in which the defeat has to be carried out.

Another popular misconception of the last months of the war is noted: a significant part of the equipment, especially tanks, is not destroyed by such drones, but is only achieved after the tank is immobilized after hitting a mine or the arrival of an ATGM and abandoned by the crew.

Drone attacks have had mixed results, with the overall effectiveness of FPV drones being less than 50%. This circumstance has been known for a long time. To destroy one dugout (for example, positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces during the assault on Avdeevka), units of the Russian Armed Forces required from eight to 12 FPV drones. Their use undoubtedly helped achieve success in a short period of time, but it turned out to be completely insane from the point of view of the economics of war.

In the article, FPV drones are called what they are in fact - improvised weapons for solving strictly defined tasks. The material says in black and white that FPV drones cannot compare with artillery ammunition when it comes to maintaining a high rate and density of fire (the same notorious weight of an artillery salvo), and in some cases drones turned out to be even more expensive than 155 mm caliber shells "Military chronicle"

original:

Before firefighters arrived, the owner of the home independently put out the flames with water and the contents of a fire extinguisher. A fire brigade arrived at the scene. There was heavy smoke in the room where the fire occurred. Firefighters installed a special smoke extractor and extinguished the fire.

A shoe locker burned down, the walls and ceiling were heavily smoked. The inspector determined that the cause of the fire was a design flaw in the manufacture of electrical equipment. https://t.me/aifmd

description: A flood in Kurgan has caused the Kuchelbecker House-Museum and the Decembrist House-Museum to stop operating. A preventive evacuation of valuable items is underway to prevent damage. The buildings themselves, including the 18th-century Decembrist Museum, are at risk.
original:
Forwarded from: Knistav
​​Because of the flood in Kurgan, the Kuchelbecker House-Museum and the Decembrist House-Museum stopped working. The regional museum association reports that a preventive evacuation of valuables is being carried out so that they will not be damaged. But buildings can.

True, the Kuchelbecker Museum is a reconstruction. A one-story wooden house was built already in the 21st century in the place where a historical house once stood and from September 1845 to March 1846 Pushkin’s lyceum friend and his family lived. But the building of the Decembrist Museum is an architectural monument of the late 18th century, too, of course, restored. It is dedicated to all the Decembrists who ended up in Kurgan after the suppression of the uprising. And among them, by the way, not only Kuchelbecker is known as a writer. Poems, memoirs, and historical works were written by Nikolai Lorer, Mikhail Nazimov, Andrei Rosen, Nikolvy Basargin, Alexander Briten and others. So both museums can be considered both historical and literary. And go there when they start working again. The quote is from Kuchelbecker’s poetic message to Volkonskaya, written in Kurgan:

“I want to leave a memory for my friends,
Guess it's the same me
That I am worthy of you, friends...
I swear by the angel who
Holy, guiding star
All your life: to the east, here,
I will turn my trembling gaze towards her
Among the storms of life and heart, -
And suddenly my azure will clear up,
And wondrous consolation will come to me,
And it will give me strength and proud patience.” Subscribe to @knistavka

Forwarded from: Quantum of Justice
By the way, in general, a lot of interesting and crazy things are still happening in West Africa - cyberpunk is taking a break.

The President of Sierra Leone recently declared a state of emergency due to an “existential threat” - an epidemic of drug addiction involving cannibalism.

Kush are rolled-up cigarettes made from synthetic rubbish, one of the main components of which is powder from human bones.

Freetown sits firmly on the jackpot. The port city, famous back in the days of the slave trade, combines slums and tourist paradise. Slums, of course, to a greater extent. Everyone, from gangsters to garbage sorters and whores, smoke human bones mixed with unknown chemicals, go crazy and die from nervous paralysis.

Grave diggers have become a serious threat, drug addicts are driven out of cemeteries almost by the National Guard, and the police are unable to cope. Flying away from hopelessness into a magical world costs a penny by local standards, such virtual reality is for the poor.

description: Ghost Autonomy, a startup working on autonomous driving software, has closed down despite raising $220 million in funding, including $5 million from OpenAI. The company failed to launch a market-ready product after changing its focus from unmanned vehicle control to crash prevention technology.
original:
Forwarded from: About tech and these
Not everything is so simple*
*with startups around OpenAI

According to TechCrunch, Ghost Autonomy, a startup working on software for self-driving cars, has closed down.

The story is surprising in that the startup has raised almost $220 million, of which OpenAI gave $5 million five months ago. Moreover, Ghost has partnered with OpenAI.

The startup, originally called Ghost Locomotion, was founded in 2017. The company promised to present a solution for unmanned vehicle control in 2020, but never implemented its plans. After that deadline, Ghost raised another $100 million in 2021 by changing its plan to focus on crash prevention technology. However, by 2024, the startup failed to launch a ready-made market product, and therefore announced its closure.TechCrunchOpenAI-backed Ghost Autonomy shuts downGhost Autonomy, a startup working on autonomous driving software for automaker partners, has shut down, TechCrunch has learned.

description: Rosatom General Director Alexey Likhachev inspected the commissioning work at Unit 1 of the Akkuyu NPP in Turkey. The final stage of construction involves setting up, monitoring, and testing to ensure reliable and safe operation of the station. original:
Full-scale commissioning work has begun at Unit 1 of the Akkuyu NPP in Turkey. Their implementation was inspected by Rosatom General Director Alexey Likhachev.

The Russian delegation toured the construction site, inspected the facilities of the nuclear and turbine island of the first block, as well as the onshore hydraulic structures of the station.

It is noted that commissioning work is the final stage of construction of a nuclear power plant unit. They include a set of operations for setting up, monitoring and testing to ensure reliable and safe operation of the station. “We are doing everything to ensure that next year the first unit of the Akkuyu NPP becomes part of the energy system of the Republic of Turkey. All our efforts and the work of Turkish companies are aimed at this.” “, Likhachev said. Let us recall that the Akkuyu NPP construction project is being implemented on the basis of an agreement between the Russian Federation and Turkey, concluded on May 12, 2010. The nuclear power plant will consist of four power units with Russian-designed VVER reactors. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Russia's share of oil imports in India increased to 35% in the latest financial year, up from 23% in the previous year. Russia supplied approximately 1.57 million barrels per day, surpassing other key suppliers like Iraq, Saudi Arabia, the UAE, and the US, whose shares decreased.
original:
Forwarded from: InfoTEK
Russian oil reigns supreme in IndiaThe share of Russian oil in the structure of India's total imports in the just ended financial year increased to 35% against 23% in the previous year.

The financial year in India begins on April 1 and ends on March 31 of the following year. During this period, Russia supplied about 1.57 million bpd compared to 1 million bpd, writes the Indian business newspaper The Economic Times, citing Vortexa data.

All other key suppliers, including Iraq, Saudi Arabia, the UAE and the US, on the contrary, have lost share in the Indian market. For example, Iraq's share fell to 20% (from 21%) - the country supplied 0.89 million bpd compared to 0.95 million bpd in the last fiscal year. Oil supplies from Saudi Arabia fell from 0.78 million b/d to 0.69 million b/d. The kingdom's share in total Indian oil imports fell to 15% from 17.5%, the UAE to 6% from 9% and the United States to 3.5% from 5.5%. Why Russian oil remains attractive to Indian refiners despite sanctions risks and reduction of discounts, as well as what role the market exchange played, read our material.@Infotek_Russia

The traditional Open Day at the university, with which ASZ has been closely cooperating for many years, was held not only for the purpose to attract 9th to 11th graders of secondary schools and senior students of secondary vocational educational institutions to enter a university, but also to introduce the children to enterprises for their possible employment in the future. In addition, the Amur Shipyard provides the opportunity to study at a specialized university under a targeted training program, having concluded a target student agreement from the moment of admission. At the same time, both parties undertake certain obligations, the fulfillment of which determines both the study and further employment of the graduate. Targeted training at Komsomolsk-on-Amur State University in the direction of the ASZ allows a school graduate who wants to obtain a specialty in the field of shipbuilding to enter educational institution in a separate competition.

description: Train traffic in the Moscow-Minsk direction was restored after the collapse of the bridge in Vyazma. The first passenger electric train 'Lastochka' passed through the repaired section, which was restored in record time, less than a day.

Governor of the Smolensk region Vasily Anokhin announced the opening of train traffic in the Moscow-Minsk direction. According to him, restoration work on two more tracks has almost been completed and railway traffic will be fully resumed in the very near future. The first passenger electric train “Lastochka” has already passed through the repaired section, the workers restored it in record time, it took them less than a day.

As Anokhin previously stated, work to eliminate the consequences of the collapse was carried out all night. While the debris was being cleared, the routes of trains traveling from Moscow to Minsk (and back), as well as to Kaliningrad, were changed.

description: Ukrainian drones, including 'Baba Yaga' strike UAVs and reusable FPVs, were observed flying in squadrons, conducting reconnaissance and dropping ammunition on targets. They operate in a coordinated manner, with DJI drones providing additional reconnaissance and an aircraft-type reconnaissance drone coordinating their actions.
original:
04/09/24. A note from the Rogozin channel.
"
The Ukrainian night is quiet, but the black night sky is teeming with enemy drones.
They fly in entire squadrons as part of pairs (precisely pairs - you can see this at once on two scans we carried out
Show more
video recording) strike UAVs of the "Baba Yaga" type (each such drone carries up to 6 ammunition and is an extremely dangerous weapon of the enemy. An FPV flies next to the "Baba Yaga", but not a kamikaze, but reusable. This type of drone is capable of diving on a target and dropping ammunition on it. A kind of unmanned bomber "Junkers". It is not difficult to distinguish them from each other - "Baba Yaga" is massive and flies in its mortar at a speed of about 60 km/h. But FPVs are nimble and faster. Their mode of operation is different, the battery discharges faster, and the drone goes to the base, and another one immediately comes in its place. Therefore, the “carousel" of drones that I observed above me is not at all chaotic. Quite the contrary - proven tactics are obvious, determined by the service life of the drones and their role and purpose in the pack.
And on the sides of this trio of killers their accomplices, DJI drones, fly and conduct additional reconnaissance. Naturally, they are all equipped with high-quality thermal imaging cameras.
They walk like this along all the front-line roads, comb forest belts, identify new situations and objects, hover over them, study them and, if they confirm that the target is worth it, they drop ammunition on it. When a ZUshka began working on drones a few kilometers away from us, all the flocks of drones interrupted their flight over the territory and immediately moved towards the detected target, methodically unwinding it.
Now enemy strike drones fly 15-17 km from the front. If at least three of our servicemen are detected, they report to their headquarters, and from there the command is immediately given to strike the coordinates with at least two cluster shells.
A “wing” is circling above all this unleashed horde of enemy drones - an aircraft-type reconnaissance drone. He coordinates the actions of a squadron or even several squadrons, ensuring their complete and undivided air supremacy.
Tough"

description: Sergei Sobyanin announced a three-year landscaping project to transform Kolomenskoye Park. The project aims to solve current problems while preserving the park's unique spirit. The renovation will take place in three stages, starting with the Moskva River embankment, followed by the amusement park, and finally the gardens, ravines, and ponds.
original:
Sergei Sobyanin told how Kolomenskoye Park will be transformed after landscaping
The update will take about three years. They will tidy up the embankment of the Moscow River, renovate the amusement park and begin the rehabilitation of gardens, ravines and a cascade of ponds.
Show more
The new project aims to solve current problems while preserving the unique spirit of the place. Since the territory of the museum-reserve is vast, the work will take place in three stages - the first this year.
Work will begin with the renovation of the Moskva River embankment. There will be a regular wedding garden with a ceremonial pavilion for 200 people, an observation deck with hanging swings, space for games, and an observation deck with areas for yoga. It is planned to tidy up the Kolomenskoye pier and expand the pedestrian part to make room for a jogging track and, in winter, a linear skating rink.
At the second stage, the amusement park will be renovated and an area near the Klenovy Boulevard metro station will be equipped, as well as a space near historical sites.
On the third, gardens, ravines and a cascade of ponds on Kolomenskoye Stream will be restored. The space around the Palace of Tsar Alexei Mikhailovich and the Dyakov settlement is being reorganized.

description: Residents of Orsk were forced to leave their homes due to flooding and are being temporarily housed at a school accommodation center. Despite excellent food and attitude, evacuees are complaining about the lack of beds, with adults and elderly people sleeping on mattresses on the floor.
original:
“Pillows, blankets somewhere. They don't give us anything. I brought the child down here and put the old people on the beds. I feel more sorry for them than for the child. The food is excellent, the attitude is excellent, but this....” The “Caution, News” correspondent visited a temporary accommodation center for residents of Orsk who had to leave their homes due to flooding. Point No. 19 is located at school No. 13 on Sorokina Street. Residents told us that people are being housed in school offices and the gym. Two families can live in one office. There are a lot of children here. Residents of Orsk who had to leave their homes complain that there are not enough beds for everyone: they are allocated mainly to children, while adults and old people sleep on mattresses on the floor. They provide bed linen from kindergarten inventory.

Teachers work at the point and are assisted by volunteers. There are now 109 evacuees here: some are already leaving, others are just moving in. Volunteers go around everyone, ask what they need, and later buy these things. A psychologist, an employee of the prosecutor’s office are on duty at the point around the clock, and doctors and the Ministry of Emergency Situations are on site. Leisure activities are organized for children.

description: Muslims celebrate Eid al-Adha, marking the end of Ramadan's month-long fast. Believers thank the Almighty for His bounties, and all fasting restrictions are lifted. The holiday, established by Prophet Muhammad in 624, is a time for feasting and festivities.
original:
On the night of April 10, Muslims celebrate Eid al-Adha. This is the first day of the new moon, which will mark the end of the month-long fast of Ramadan. At this time, all restrictions of fasting are lifted, and believers thank the Almighty for the opportunity to benefit from His bounties.

The Eid al-Fitr holiday lasts from one to three days, but feasts can last much longer. If it falls at the beginning or middle of the week, the festivities can last until the weekend.

It is believed that the celebration of the day of breaking the fast was established by the Prophet Muhammad in 624. In Arabic, this date sounds like “Eid al-Fitr”. This translated into Russian means “the holiday of breaking the fast.” The name "Eid al-Adha" comes from Turkic languages. In Persian, “ruza” means fasting, and “bayram” means holiday.

The editors of Lomovka congratulate all Muslim believers on this holiday and wish them joy and prosperity.📮Subscribe to Lomovka

event: Oman Air Force Considering Purchase of Rafale Fighters
description: The Sultanate of Oman is assessing the possibility of purchasing Rafale F4 fighters from Dassault Aviation to diversify its sources of supply. The potential purchase of 18-24 aircraft is part of Oman's strategy to strengthen its defensive capabilities, given its proximity to Yemen.
original:
Forwarded from: Wings of War
🇴🇲Oman Air Force is assessing the possibility of purchasing Rafale fighters As reported by The New York Times, the Sultanate of Oman has expressed interest in purchasing Rafale F4 fighters from the French company Dassault Aviation. Currently, the Oman Air Force is armed with the American F-16 and Typhoon of the European consortium Eurofighter, but interest in Rafale is determined by the desire to diversify sources of supply.

Oman is reported to be considering purchasing between 18 and 24 new aircraft. The order is in line with the strategy being implemented by the country’s authorities to strengthen its defensive capabilities (taking into account its geographic proximity to Yemen).

The potential purchase of Rafale represents a significant shift in the Sultanate's arms and military equipment procurement policy, given that in 2012 Typhoon fighter jets were purchased following a competition involving a French company. An order of fighter jets from France will somewhat undermine the position of Great Britain, which has historically been the leading supplier of arms and military equipment to Oman. Previously, military-technical cooperation between France and Oman was limited to the acquisition of Airbus A320 aircraft for transporting dignitaries and 6 EC-225LP Super Puma helicopters.@wingsofwar

description: A fake mobilization call was spread in the Russian Federation, allegedly confirmed by the order of the military commissar for the Rostov region. The document was fabricated from a real order from 2022, with several obvious mistakes, including identical paragraphs and a signature made with a black fountain pen.
original:
Fake: A mobilization call begins in the Russian Federation, which is confirmed by the order of the military commissar for the Rostov region. Ex-adviser to the mayor of Mariupol Pyotr Andryushchenko writes about this. Truth: The document demonstrated by Andryushchenko, who has been repeatedly convicted of spreading fakes, is fake. The basis was taken from a real order from 2022, when the call for partial mobilization took place.

The fake launchers, trying to fulfill their main task - to discredit the Russian Federation and spread panic, were in such a hurry that they made several obvious mistakes at once. For example, paragraphs 3 and 5 of a fake document are absolutely identical in content.

In addition, the document contains a signature made with a black fountain pen. In reality, it should be written with a pen and blue ink. And this is not the cost of photocopying, as one might think, but a mistake made by fakes: judging by the color of the print, this is a color copy, not a black and white one. Finally, the signature of military commissar Igor Egorov itself looks different in reality.

The topic of mobilization in the Russian Federation regularly becomes fertile ground for those who create and distribute fake news. At the same time, unfortunately, not only in Ukraine: also on Russian territory there are those who, in pursuit of hype, are ready to speculate on this topic. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” so as not to be deceived.

According to SHOT, bailiffs are now handling the debts of Kaif LLC, under which the KAIF Provenance restaurant operates on Bolshaya Dmitrovka. Five enforcement proceedings have already been launched. event: Security Agreement in the North Sea
description: Norway, Great Britain, Belgium, Denmark, the Netherlands, and Germany signed a joint declaration to enhance security in the North Sea. The agreement enables information exchange and cooperation to protect critical infrastructure, including gas pipelines and undersea cables.
original:
⚡️Norway, Great Britain, Belgium, Denmark, the Netherlands and Germany enter into an agreement on security in the North Sea. Six countries signed a joint declaration, which, among other things, makes it possible to exchange information.

Norwegian Energy Minister Terje Åsland said in an interview with NRK: In the North Sea, we have a common interest with our neighbors in protecting our critical infrastructure. Belgium is investing one million euros in a secure communications platform that will help countries cooperate. Here, countries will be able to exchange information about suspicious incidents that could affect the security of North Sea infrastructure, such as gas pipelines.

British Nuclear Energy Minister Andrew Bowie commented on the agreement: The North Sea is driving Europe's renewable energy and net-zero emissions ambitions, while also helping to strengthen energy security on the continent. That's why it is critical that we protect critical energy infrastructure now and in the future. Threats to undersea cables and pipelines have become a security focus for Western European countries following the September 2022 explosions at the Nord Stream 1 and Nord Stream 2 gas pipelines. NRKSignerer sikkerheitspakt for Nordsjøen: – Saman er me sterkareNoreg og fem andre Nordsjøland signerer millionpakt for å sikre kommunikasjon og viktig straumforsyning.

This morning in France, two young girls organized a small anti-immigration campaign with posters. Their placards read: "Foreign rapists out" and "Free us from migration".

One of the activists, the one on the left, a 19-year-old girl named Yona, was arrested by the police. Later, police officers appeared at the girl's house, and searched her father's house in search of other anti-immigration posters.

description: The launch of the first Angara-A5 rocket from Vostochny cosmodrome was delayed by a day due to technical reasons. The automation system halted the process two minutes before launch due to a failure in the pressurization system of the oxidizer tank of the central unit.
original:
Forwarded from: Roscosmos State Corporation
Yuri Borisov: the launch of the first Angara-A5 rocket from Vostochny was postponed for a day. The launch of the first Angara-A5 launch vehicle from the Vostochny cosmodrome, planned for today, was postponed to April 10 for technical reasons. “Two minutes before the possible launch, the automation stopped the process from - due to a failure in the pressurization system of the oxidizer tank of the central unit [launch rocket]. In this situation, fuel is drained; let’s finally understand the reasons. And, preliminary, the start is scheduled for a reserve date, tomorrow,” said the head of the State Corporation Yuri Borisov.

description: The first launch of the Angara-A5 rocket from the Vostochny cosmodrome has been delayed by a day. The rocket, weighing 761 tons when fueled, is capable of delivering satellites into orbit with its Orion upper stage.
original:
The first launch of the Angara-A5 rocket from the Vostochny cosmodrome has been postponed for a day. REN TV correspondent Evgeniy Podtergera reports this from the scene.

The oxygen-kerosene Angara-A5 weighs 761 tons when fueled. The Orion upper stage at maximum filling with naphthyl is another 22.1 tons. It can fire its propulsion system up to five times to deliver the satellite into the desired orbit.

"Angara-A5" is the first heavy launch vehicle created in Russia after the collapse of the USSR. With its help, they are going to launch modules for the future orbital station and other cargo into orbit. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Russian Ambassador Comments on Western Leadership
description: Russian Ambassador to the UK Andrei Kelin stated that Western leaders are trying to save their image before Ukraine's defeat. He commented on a joint article by the Foreign Ministers of Great Britain and France, David Cameron and Stéphane Sejournet, who warned of catastrophic consequences for the West if Ukraine loses. Kelin believes the leaders are making desperate attempts to save face, as their erroneous bets on helping Kyiv will be exposed.
original:
🇬🇧🇫🇷The Western leadership is trying to save its image before the defeat of Ukraine. This was stated by the Russian Ambassador to the UK Andrei Kelin, commenting on a joint article by the Foreign Ministers of Great Britain and France. David Cameron and Stéphane Sejournet published an article the day before in which they stated that the defeat of Ukraine would have catastrophic consequences for the entire West. “If you read between the lines, it is extremely clear that the losers will not be Western countries, but only representatives of their leadership, who knowingly did erroneous bet on helping Kyiv. It will really be difficult for them to get out of the situation without losing face. That is why they are making desperate attempts to save their image,” Kelin noted.

According to the diplomat, the ministers did not explain to readers what grave consequences the defeat of Ukraine would have for the Western population. Horror stories about the war with Russia, according to Kelin, have long ceased to scare anyone, as have theses about the “values of the free world.” “After all, you can’t tell ordinary readers why it’s bad that peace will finally come in Europe, and their taxes henceforth, they will not go to fuel the corrupt regime of Vladimir Zelensky and senseless supplies of weapons to the Kyiv military, which is unsuccessfully wasting them,” added Ambassador Ostashko! Important - subscribe

event: Russian Ambassador's Response to US Accusations
description: Russian Ambassador A.I. Antonov responded to US accusations of spreading propaganda in Congress, stating that Americans are growing tired of financing Ukraine and that the US ruling class refuses to acknowledge its wrong policy towards Russia.
original: Answer of the Russian Ambassador to the USA A.I. Antonov to a media question❓: Dear Anatoly Ivanovich, how could you comment on the statements of the head of the House Intelligence Committee M. Turner, convincing the American public that Russia is allegedly spreading propaganda in Congress when Are we talking about allocating aid to Ukraine?💬A.I. Antonov: In America, not a day goes by without blaming our country for all its sins. Without checking the facts and presenting evidence. In the West, the population is objectively growing tired of the burden of financing Ukraine. This is not an invention of Russian propaganda. Ordinary Americans do not understand why they should work hard and pay taxes, which will then be used to financially and militarily pump up a distant Eastern European country. A heap of acute socio-economic problems has accumulated in the United States. For many politicians and ordinary Americans, this is the main thing.❗️The ruling class in America does not recognize the wrongness of its policy towards Russia after the collapse of the USSR. It is not for nothing that M. Turner attacked with furious criticism the fellow party members who dared to hint at the expansion of NATO as the root cause of a special military operation. It is obvious that the Washington “hawks” do not need an end to the conflict, but the exhaustion of our country, even at the cost of the death of hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians. Or better yet, the disappearance of the Russian Federations from the geopolitical map of the world.👉Hence all these stories that after Ukraine, Russia will supposedly inevitably attack the states of the North Atlantic Alliance. Anything that does not fit into this picture is discarded and declared disinformation.✊We will continue to stand up for the truth. If the truth destroys stereotypes that are convenient and beneficial for the US authorities, this is not our problem. Washington's painful reaction to such work only speaks of its effectiveness.

description: Moldova's ruling party proposes a referendum on amending the Constitution to include Moldova's membership in the European Union. However, the EU has not given its consent to Moldova's membership, raising questions about the purpose of the referendum.
original:
The ruling party of Moldova proposes to include the following question on the ballot for the autumn referendum on amending the Constitution: “Are you in favor of the Republic of Moldova joining the European Union?”

Excuse me, but what is the connection between the change in the Constitution of Moldova and Moldova’s membership in an organization that has not given its consent to Moldova’s membership and may not give its consent?

Is the referendum for stupid people? Or are stupid people initiating a referendum for some other purpose? Maybe “good people” at least once in their worthless lives will try to be honest and ask the correct question: “Are you in favor of introducing an article on European integration into the Constitution”?

Otherwise, you know, it is possible to hold such referendums... And, apparently, they will.Upd. Some kind of referendum on the issue of Moldova joining the EAEU will then sound like this: “Are you in favor of Moldova receiving cheap gas”?

However, this did not prevent its fighters from believing in various small-town and not very magical cults, which some like to call “voodoo” (which is not entirely correct).

But the magic of “Wagner” always turned out to be stronger.

description: Chinese CRRC, the world's largest rolling stock manufacturer, invested over $2 billion in R&D projects in 2023, accounting for 6.3% of its total revenue. This is the highest level of investment in R&D over the past 5 years. The company employed over 19,000 people in R&D, with 11 national-level scientific centers, 22 technology centers, and 18 research centers abroad.
original:
Forwarded from: ROLLINGSTOCK
Chinese CRRC continues to increase investment in R&D. According to the world's largest rolling stock manufacturer, in 2023 it allocated more than 14.3 billion yuan (about $2 billion) to R&D projects. This volume amounts to 6.3% of the company’s total revenue (234.3 billion yuan or $32.4 billion, +5.1% by 2022). This is the highest level of CRRC investment in R&D over the past 5 years, both in volume and in relation to revenue. In 2019-2022, the share of investment in R&D in the revenue of the Chinese manufacturer grew annually, from 5.2% to 6.0%.

CRRC also indicates in the report that in the field of R&D in 2023 it employed 19 thousand people or more than 12% of its staff. According to the company, within its perimeter there are 11 national-level scientific centers, 22 technology centers at enterprises, 16 industry research institutes, as well as 18 research centers in foreign countries. In 2023, they implemented a total of about 420 research projects on rolling stock and components. Among the key projects, CRRC highlights work on a high-speed train for speeds up to 450 km/h, a series A commuter train for speeds of 120 km/h, a new generation of regional electric trains CINOVA 2.0, a hydrogen train for operation in urban environment and others.

According to the report, in 2023 the company signed contracts worth 298.6 billion yuan ($41.3 billion), of which 20% were export orders, despite all the opposition in Europe and the United States. CRRC estimated its order portfolio at the end of 2023 at 270.3 billion yuan ($37.4 billion), the share of foreign contracts is 42%. The machine manufacturer points out that the share of the Chinese national carrier China Railway and its subsidiaries accounted for 38.4% of revenue in 2023.

Among the main goals of the CRRC is the development of the service of railway rolling stock, the intensification of developments in terms of trams, maglev and monorail, the production and standardization of key components. Photo: Caixin Global@rollingstock

description: Ukraine's President Zelenskiy emphasized the need for reliable air defense systems and missiles to counter Russian terror, which has been destroying cities and killing civilians. He urged the world to take action and provide greater protection for Ukraine's skies.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Kharkiv needs reliable protection. There is a solution to the constant Russian terror - air defense systems and missiles for them are needed. The world has no right to remain indifferent at a time when Russia is single-mindedly destroying cities and killing people in their homes day after day. Ukraine needs greater protection of the sky.

event: Delivery of Equipment to Northern Military District
description: The Presidential Plenipotentiary Representative delivered a batch of modern equipment, including electronic warfare stations, unmanned aerial vehicles, rifles, and sighting systems, to the Northern Military District. This systematic approach ensures uninterrupted supply to the front lines, supporting soldiers in combat missions.
original:
🛡Let's support until Victory: the Presidential Plenipotentiary Representative brought a batch of equipment to the Northern Military District. On behalf of Yuri Trutnev, Far Eastern soldiers continue to receive modern weapons, uniforms and vehicles to successfully carry out combat missions.

A systematic approach and the inclusion of large Far Eastern enterprises in the supply chain made it possible to achieve real success on the Northern Military District fronts and ensure uninterrupted and constant supply. “Equipment changes, technology changes. Previously, we brought electronic warfare stations of the same type. Now there is a much wider range, including those produced by our industry. It’s the same with unmanned aerial vehicles, with rifles, with sighting systems. New lines are appearing that are in demand on the front line, which allow our soldiers to work more successfully. Such support will continue until our Victory,” Yuri Trutnev emphasized. Military personnel, mobilized and volunteers in Donbass once again received from the plenipotentiary representative radio reconnaissance equipment, unmanned aerial systems, snow and swamp-going vehicles and other vehicles. Also, medical supplies, hemostatic drugs and hemostatic tourniquets produced at Far Eastern enterprises “arrived” at the front line.

description: DOSAAF activists have begun restoring the oldest shooting gallery in Yalta, which was featured in the film 'Assu'. The 85-year-old building has a rich history, having been restored by DOSAAF members after World War II and later falling into disrepair under Ukrainian rule.
original:
The oldest shooting gallery in Yalta, where “Assu” was filmed, has begun to be restored by DOSAAF activists. This year the legendary building in Primorsky Park is 85 years old. The history of the place is fascinating: in 1941 it was half destroyed, the ruins served as a mailbox for partisans who left notes there. When Yalta was liberated from fascist occupation, the premises were restored by DOSAAF members, it worked for several decades, gained city popularity and even cinematic fame after the filming of “Assy”.

Under Ukraine, the building fell into disrepair, no money was allocated for restoration, they even wanted to sell it, but the townspeople did not allow it then. When the Yalta branch of DOSAAF was headed by Vladimir Babko, the old shooting range came to life: sporting events were held there and they taught how to use weapons. Over the past 10 years, the defencists had to carry out repairs four times: sometimes tree branches damaged the roof, sometimes the floor collapsed by 15 cm.

Mash on the wave@crimea24new

description: Liliya Chanysheva, head of Navalny's regional headquarters, had her sentence increased by two years to 9.5 years by the Supreme Court of Bashkortostan. The prosecutor's office had sought a 10-year sentence, deeming the original 7.5-year sentence too lenient.
original:
Liliya Chanysheva, the head of Navalny’s “headquarters”*, had her sentence increased by two years - to 9.5 years. The prosecutor's office wanted to tighten it even more - up to 10 years. The Supreme Court of Bashkortostan increased the sentence for Liliya Chanysheva, the head of Navalny's regional “headquarters,” by two years.

In the summer of 2023, Chanysheva was already sentenced to 7 and a half years in prison and a fine of 400 thousand rubles for “participation in an extremist community” - this is the status of organizations of Navalny’s supporters in Russia.

However, on March 4, the Bashkortostan Court of Cassation returned Chanysheva’s case for a new trial to the Supreme Court due to the position of the prosecutor’s office. Prosecutors considered the sentence “too lenient” and demanded a more severe punishment - 10 years in prison.* Recognized as an extremist organization, activities are prohibited.
